resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance the historic
instance authorization is related to. Can be `null` if not related to a historic instance
resource.

id.description: The id of the authorization.

type.description:
The type of the authorization (0=global, 1=grant, 2=revoke). See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service.md#authorization-type)
for more information about authorization types.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

resourceType.description:
An integer representing the resource type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service/#resources)
for a list of integer representations of resource types.

removalTime.description:
The removal time indicates the date a historic instance
authorization is cleaned up. A removal time can only be assigned to a historic
instance authorization. Can be `null` when not related to a historic instance
resource or when the removal time strategy is end and the root process instance
is not finished. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

dmnXml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this decision requirements definition
was deployed with. Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks
are escaped.

id.description: The id of the decision requirements definition.

rel.description: The relation of the link to the object that belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition this job definition is associated with.

activityId.description: The id of the activity this job definition is associated with.

overridingJobPriority.description:
The execution priority defined for jobs that are created based on this definition.
May be `null` when the priority has not been overridden on the job
definition level.

deploymentId.description:
The id of the deployment this job definition is related to. In a deployment-aware
setup, this leads to all jobs of the same definition being executed
on the same node.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant this job definition is associated with.

id.description: The id of the job definition.

jobConfiguration.description:
The configuration of a job definition provides details about the jobs which will be
created. For example: for timer jobs it is the timer configuration.

jobType.description:
The type of the job which is running for this job definition. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job types.

suspended.description: Indicates whether this job definition is suspended or not.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition this job definition is associated with.

warnings.description: A list of warnings occurred during parsing.

errors.description: A list of errors occurred during parsing.

installation.description:
An id which is unique for each installation of Camunda. It is stored once per database so all
engines connected to the same database will have the same installation ID.
The ID is used to identify a single installation of Camunda Platform.

name.description: The name of the group.

id.description: The id of the group.

type.description: The type of the group.

PasswordPolicyRuleDto.description: Describes a rule of a password policy.

parameter.description: A map that describes the characteristics of a password policy rule, such as the minimum number of digits.

placeholder.description: A placeholder string that contains the name of a password policy rule.

resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

resourceType.description:
An integer representing the resource type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service/#resources)
for a list of integer representations of resource types.

annotation.description: The annotation set to the incident.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition this incident is associated with.

processInstanceId.description: The key of the process definition this incident is associated with.

jobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id the incident is associated with.

causeIncidentId.description: The id of the associated cause incident which has been triggered.

incidentType.description:
The type of incident, for example: `failedJobs` will be returned in case of an
incident which identified a failed job during the execution of a
process instance. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-
guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of
incident types.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition this incident is associated with.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the incident should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

executionId.description: The id of the execution this incident is associated with.

activityId.description: The id of the activity this incident is associated with.

deleted.description: If true, this incident has been deleted.

rootCauseIncidentId.description: The id of the associated root cause incident which has been triggered.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant this incident is associated with.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this incident.

id.description: The id of the incident.

endTime.description:
The time this incident has been deleted or resolved. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

failedActivityId.description: The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred.

open.description: If true, this incident is open.

historyConfiguration.description: The payload of this incident at the time when it occurred.

resolved.description: If true, this incident has been resolved.

deletionLog.description: A flag indicating whether this log represents the deletion of the associated job.

jobDueDate.description: The date on which the associated job is supposed to be processed.

successLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the successful execution of the
associated job.

jobDefinitionConfiguration.description: The job definition configuration type of the associated job.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the log entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further info see the
[docs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition which the associated job belongs to.

failureLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the failed execution of the
associated job.

activityId.description: The id of the activity on which the associated job was created.

hostname.description:
The name of the host of the Process Engine where the
job of this historic job log entry was executed.

deploymentId.description: The id of the deployment which the associated job belongs to.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
which the associated job belongs to.

id.description: The id of the log entry.

jobPriority.description: The execution priority the job had when the log entry was created.

timestamp.description: The time when the log entry has been written.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance on which the associated job was created.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition which the associated job belongs to.

jobDefinitionId.description: The id of the job definition on which the associated job was created.

creationLog.description: A flag indicating whether this log represents the creation of the associated job.

jobExceptionMessage.description: The message of the exception that occurred by executing the associated job.

jobDefinitionType.description:
The job definition type of the associated job. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job definition types.

jobId.description: The id of the associated job.

jobRetries.description: The number of retries the associated job has left.

executionId.description: The execution id on which the associated job was created.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic job log entry belongs to.

failedActivityId.description:
The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred by executing the
associated job.

processInstances.description: A list of process instance ids to fetch jobs, for which retries will be set.

average.description: The average duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

period.description:
Specifies a timespan within a year.
**Note:** The period must be interpreted in conjunction with the returned `periodUnit`.

maximum.description: The greatest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

periodUnit.description: The unit of the given period. Possible values are `MONTH` and `QUARTER`.

minimum.description: The smallest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were started in the given period.

processInstanceIds.description:
A list of process instance ids which defines a group of process instances
which will be activated or suspended by the operation.

failures.description: A list of variable validation report messages.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                      a JSON object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                      identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                      etc.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

messageName.description: The name of the message to deliver.

all.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should be correlated to exactly one entity or multiple entities.
If the value is set to `false`, the message will be correlated to exactly one entity (execution or process definition).
If the value is set to `true`, the message will be correlated to multiple executions and a process definition that
can be instantiated by this message in one go.

processInstanceId.description: Used to correlate the message to the process instance with the given id.

localCorrelationKeys.description:
Local variables used for correlation of executions (process instances) that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against local variables during correlation.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

businessKey.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Will only correlate to executions that belong to a process instance with the provided business key.

tenantId.description:
Used to correlate the message for a tenant with the given id.
Will only correlate to executions and process definitions which belong to the tenant.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `withoutTenantId`.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the message should only be correlated to executions
and process definitions which belong to no tenant or not. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.
Must not be supplied in conjunction with a `tenantId`.

correlationKeys.description:
Used for correlation of process instances that wait for incoming messages.
Has to be a JSON object containing key-value pairs that are matched against process instance variables
during correlation. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the
following properties.

processVariables.description:
A map of variables that is injected into the triggered execution or process instance after the message
has been delivered. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with
the following properties.

processVariablesLocal.description:
A map of local variables that is injected into the triggered execution or process instance after the
message has been delivered. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object
with the following properties.

resultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should be returned or not.
If this property is set to `true`, there will be returned a list of message correlation result objects. Depending on the
all property, there will be either one ore more returned results in the list.

The default value is `false`, which means no result will be returned.

variablesInResultEnabled.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the result of the correlation should contain process variables or not.
The parameter resultEnabled should be set to `true` in order to use this it.

The default value is `false`, which means the variables will not be returned.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the deployment.

name.description: The name of the deployment.

id.description: The id of the deployment.

deploymentTime.description: The time when the deployment was created.

EventSubscriptionQueryDto.description: A event subscription query which retrieves a list of event subscriptions

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

includeEventSubscriptionsWithoutTenantId.description:
Select event subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Can be used in combination with tenantIdIn parameter.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

eventSubscriptionId.description: The id of the event subscription.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
Only select subscriptions that belong to one of the given tenant ids.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only select subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

historicDecisionInstanceIds.description: A list of historic decision instance ids to delete.

GroupQueryDto.description: A group instance query which defines a list of group instances

idIn.description: Filter by a JSON string array of group ids.

nameLike.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

name.description: Filter by the name of the group.

member.description: Only retrieve groups where the given user id is a member of.

id.description: Filter by the id of the group.

type.description: Filter by the type of the group.

memberOfTenant.description: Only retrieve groups which are members of the given tenant.

TransitionInstanceDto.description: A JSON object corresponding to the Activity Instance tree of the given process instance.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this instance enters (asyncBefore job) or leaves (asyncAfter job)

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance this instance is part of.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

executionId.description: The execution id.

activityName.description: The name of the activity that this instance enters (asyncBefore job) or leaves (asyncAfter job)

incidents.description:
A list of JSON objects containing incident specific properties:
* `id`: the id of the incident
* `activityId`: the activity id in which the incident occurred

id.description: The id of the transition instance.

activityType.description: The type of the activity that this instance enters (asyncBefore job) or leaves (asyncAfter job)

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

valid.description: `true` if the password is compliant with this rule, otherwise `false`.

newDuration.description:
An amount of time (in milliseconds). This is the new lock duration starting from the
current moment.

HistoricDetailQueryDto.description: A historic detail query which defines a group of historic details.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

variableTypeIn.description:
Only include historic details where the variable updates belong to one of the passed 
list of variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type `serializable`.

initial.description:
Restrict to historic variable updates that contain only initial variable values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

occurredBefore.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured before the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Only include historic details which belong to one of the passed  process instance ids.

userOperationId.description: Filter by a user operation id.

executionId.description: Filter by execution id.

variableUpdates.description: Only include `HistoricVariableUpdates`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

tenantIdIn.description: Filter by a  list of tenant ids.

occurredAfter.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured after the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

excludeTaskDetails.description:
Excludes all task-related `HistoricDetails`, so only items which have no task id set will be selected.
When this parameter is used together with `taskId`, this call is ignored and task details are not excluded.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                    a JSON object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                    identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                    etc. Does not have an effect for the `count` endpoint.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic details that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

formFields.description: Only include `HistoricFormFields`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent properties.
For serialized variables of type Object, the following properties can be provided:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type name.
* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store the variable.

For serialized variables of type File, the following properties can be provided:

* `filename`: The name of the file. This is not the variable name but the name that will be used when downloading the file again.
* `mimetype`: The MIME type of the file that is being uploaded.
* `encoding`: The encoding of the file that is being uploaded.

The following property can be provided for all value types:

* `transient`: Indicates whether the variable should be transient or
not. See [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables#transient-variables) for more informations.
(Not applicable for `decision-definition`, ` /process-instance/variables-async`, and `/migration/executeAsync` endpoints)

type.description: The value type of the variable.

ExternalTaskQueryDto.description: A JSON object with the following properties:
ExternalTaskQueryDto.title: ExternalTaskQueryDto

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance that an external task belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the id of the process definition that an external task belongs to.

workerId.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

withRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

notLocked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

lockExpirationAfter.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

active.description: Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids that an external task may belong to.

suspended.description: Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity that an external task is created for.

executionId.description: Filter by the id of the execution that an external task belongs to.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

lockExpirationBefore.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
An external task must have one of the given tenant ids.

sorting.description:
A JSON array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is a JSON object that
                    specifies one ordering. The position in the array identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether
                    it is primary, secondary, etc. The ordering objects have the following properties:

                    **Note:** The `sorting` properties will not be applied to the External Task count query.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

topicName.description: Filter by an external task topic.

noRetriesLeft.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

externalTaskId.description: Filter by an external task's id.

locked.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

externalTaskIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

activityIdIn.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of ids of the activities that an external task is created for.

variableReports.description:
A map of variable reports.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON object consisting of the variable's type, value,
value info object and a list of failures.

instructionReports.description:
The list of instruction validation reports. If no validation
errors are detected it is an empty list.

resourceId.description:
The resource Id. The value `*` represents an authorization ranging over all
instances of a resource.

permissions.description: An array of Strings holding the permissions provided by this authorization.

groupId.description: The id of the group this authorization has been created for.

type.description:
The type of the authorization (0=global, 1=grant, 2=revoke). See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service.md#authorization-type)
for more information about authorization types.

userId.description:
The id of the user this authorization has been created for. The value `*`
represents a global authorization ranging over all users.

resourceType.description:
An integer representing the resource type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/authorization-service/#resources)
for a list of integer representations of resource types.

binding.description: The binding of the Camunda Form. Can be `latest`, `deployment` or `version`.

version.description: The specific version of a Camunda Form. This property is only set if `binding` is `version`.

key.description: The key of the Camunda Form.

workerId.description:
**Mandatory.** The id of the worker on which behalf tasks are fetched. The returned tasks are locked for
that worker and can only be completed when providing the same worker id.

asyncResponseTimeout.description:
The [Long Polling](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/external-tasks/#long-polling-to-fetch-and-lock-external-tasks)
timeout in milliseconds.

**Note:** The value cannot be set larger than 1.800.000 milliseconds (corresponds to 30 minutes).

maxTasks.description: **Mandatory.** The maximum number of tasks to return.

topics.description:
A JSON array of topic objects for which external tasks should be fetched. The returned tasks may be
arbitrarily distributed among these topics. Each topic object has the following properties:

usePriority.description:
A `boolean` value, which indicates whether the task should be fetched based on its priority
or arbitrarily.

url.description: The url to the remote content of the attachment.

password.description: The candidate password to be check against the password policy.

annotation.description: An arbitrary text annotation set by a user for auditing reasons.

instructions.description: JSON array of modification instructions. The instructions are executed in the order they are in.

skipIoMappings.description:
Skip execution of [input/output variable mappings](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#input-output-variable-mapping)
for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

skipCustomListeners.description: Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

workerId.description:
The id of the worker that reports the failure. Must match the id of the worker who has most recently
locked the task.

HistoricActivityInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic activity instance query which defines a group of historic activity instances

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by process definition id.

finishedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

activityName.description: Filter by the activity name (according to BPMN 2.0 XML).

finished.description:
Only include finished activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

completeScope.description:
Only include activity instances which completed a scope.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

executionId.description: Filter by the id of the execution that executed the activity instance.

activityId.description: Filter by the activity id (according to BPMN 2.0 XML).

canceled.description:
Only include canceled activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

tenantIdIn.description: Must be a JSON array of Strings. An activity instance must have one of the given tenant ids.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

taskAssignee.description: Only include activity instances that are user tasks and assigned to a given user.

withoutTenantId.description: Only include historic activity instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

unfinished.description:
Only include unfinished activity instances.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` behaves the same as when the property is not set.

startedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

startedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

finishedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

batchWindowEndTime.description:
End time of the current or next batch window. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

batchWindowStartTime.description:
Start time of the current or next batch window. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

enabled.description:
Indicates whether the engine node participates in history cleanup or
not. The default is `true`. Participation can be disabled via
[Process Engine Configuration](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/deployment-descriptors/tags/process-engine/#history-cleanup-enabled).

For more details, see
[Cleanup Execution Participation per Node](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#cleanup-execution-participation-per-node).

ProcessInstanceQueryDto.description: A process instance query which defines a group of process instances

subProcessInstance.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that have the given process instance as a sub process instance.
Takes a process instance id.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

withIncident.description: Filter by presence of incidents. Selects only process instances that have an incident.

incidentType.description: Filter by the incident type. See the User Guide for a list of incident types.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances run on.

processDefinitionWithoutTenantId.description: Only include process instances which process definition has no tenant id.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids.
Must be a JSON array of Strings.

deploymentId.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

processDefinitionKeyNotIn.description:
Exclude instances by a list of process definition keys.
A process instance must not have one of the given process definition keys. Must be a JSON array of Strings.

rootProcessInstances.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are top level process instances.

leafProcessInstances.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are leaf instances. (i.e. don't have any sub instances)

activityIdIn.description:
Filter by a list of activity ids.
A process instance must currently wait in a leaf activity with one of the given activity ids.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the instances run on.

variables.description:
A JSON array to only include process instances that have variables with certain values.
The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator` and `value`.
`name` (String) is the variable name,
`operator` (String) is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
The `value` may be String, Number or Boolean.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

incidentMessage.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

businessKeyLike.description: Filter by process instance business key that the parameter is a substring of.

processDefinitionKeyIn.description:
Filter by a list of process definition keys.
A process instance must have one of the given process definition keys. Must be a JSON array of Strings.

superCaseInstance.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance.
Takes a case instance id.

active.description: Only include active process instances. Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

suspended.description: Only include suspended process instances. Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

processInstanceIds.description: Filter by a list of process instance ids. Must be a JSON array of Strings.

subCaseInstance.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that have the given case instance as a sub case instance.
Takes a case instance id.

superProcessInstance.description:
Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given process instance.
Takes a process instance id.

orQueries.description:
A JSON array of nested process instance queries with OR semantics.
A process instance matches a nested query if it fulfills at least one of the query's predicates.
With multiple nested queries, a process instance must fulfill at least one predicate of each query (Conjunctive Normal Form).
All process instance query properties can be used except for: `sorting`
See the [User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-engine-api/#or-queries) for more information about OR queries.

businessKey.description: Filter by process instance business key.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include process instances which belong to no tenant.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

incidentMessageLike.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

allOf.description:
Defines by which selection criterion to activate or suspend jobs.
This selection criterion are mutually exclusive and can only be on of:
* `jobDefinitionId`
* `processDefinitionId`
* `processInstanceId`
* `processDefinitionKey`

processDefinitionId.description: The process definition id of the jobs to activate or suspend.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the jobs to activate or suspend.

processDefinitionWithoutTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend jobs of a process definition which belongs to no tenant.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior. Works only when selecting with `processDefinitionKey`.

jobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id of the jobs to activate or suspend.

processDefinitionTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend jobs of a process definition which belongs to a tenant
with the given id. Works only when selecting with `processDefinitionKey`.

processDefinitionKey.description: The process definition key of the jobs to activate or suspend.

suspended.description:
A Boolean value which indicates whether to activate or suspend a given instance 
(e.g. process instance, job, job definition, or batch). When the value is set to true, 
the given instance will be suspended and when the value is set to false, 
the given instance will be activated.

DeploymentResourceDto.description:
A JSON object corresponding to the `Resource` interface in the engine.
Its properties are as follows:
DeploymentResourceDto.title: DeploymentResourceDto

name.description: The name of the deployment resource

id.description: The id of the deployment resource.

valid.description: `true` if the password is compliant with the policy, otherwise `false`.

@class.description:
The fully qualified class name of the data transfer object class.
The class name might change in future releases.

instances.description: The total number of running process instances of this activity.

failedJobs.description:
The total number of failed jobs for the running instances.
**Note**: Will be `0` (not `null`), if failed jobs were excluded.

incidents.description:
Each item in the resulting array is an object which contains `incidentType` and `incidentCount`.
**Note**: Will be an empty array, if `incidents` or `incidentsForType` were excluded.
Furthermore, the array will be also empty if no incidents were found.

id.description: The id of the activity the results are aggregated for.

processDefinitionId.description: Used to evaluate conditions of the process definition with the given id.

variables.description:
A map of variables which are used for evaluation of the conditions and are injected into the process instances which have been triggered.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties.

businessKey.description: Used for the process instances that have been triggered after the evaluation.

tenantId.description:
Used to evaluate a condition for a tenant with the given id.
Will only evaluate conditions of process definitions which belong to the tenant.

withoutTenantId.description:
A Boolean value that indicates whether the conditions should only be evaluated of process definitions which belong to no tenant or not.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

ExecutionQueryDto.description: A Execution instance query which defines a list of Execution instances

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

variables.description:
An array to only include executions that have variables with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.

incidentMessage.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

incidentType.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

active.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

signalEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

suspended.description:
Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

messageEventSubscriptionName.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

activityId.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a  list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Has no effect for the `/count` endpoint

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

businessKey.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

processVariables.description:
An array to only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables
with certain values.

The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator`
and `value`.
`name (String)` is the variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison
operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.

incidentMessageLike.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

SortTaskQueryParametersDto.description:
Mandatory when `sortBy` is one of the following values: `processVariable`, `executionVariable`,
`taskVariable`, `caseExecutionVariable` or `caseInstanceVariable`. Must be a JSON object with the properties
`variable` and `type` where `variable` is a variable name and `type` is the name of a variable value type.

variable.description: The name of the variable to sort by.

type.description: The name of the type of the variable value.

dmnXml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this decision definition was deployed with.
Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks are escaped.

id.description: The id of the decision definition.

owner.description: The user id of the owner of the filter.

query.description: The query of the filter as a JSON object.

name.description: The name of the filter.

properties.description: The properties of a filter as a JSON object.

resourceType.description: The resource type of the filter.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

type.description: The type of identity link (candidate/assignee/owner).

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the identity link should be removed by the History Cleanup job. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this identity link.

id.description: Id of the Historic identity link entry.

time.description:
The time when the identity link is logged. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

activityId.description:
**Can be used with instructions of types** `startBeforeActivity`
and `startAfterActivity`. Specifies the sequence flow to start.

transitionId.description:
**Can be used with instructions of types** `startTransition`.
Specifies the sequence flow to start.

type.description:
**Mandatory**. One of the following values: `startBeforeActivity`, `startAfterActivity`, `startTransition`.

* A `startBeforeActivity` instruction requests to enter a given activity.
* A `startAfterActivity` instruction requests to execute the single outgoing sequence flow of a given activity.
* A `startTransition` instruction requests to execute a specific sequence flow.

activityId.description: Can be used with instructions of types `startTransition`. Specifies the sequence flow to start.

transitionId.description: Can be used with instructions of types `startTransition`. Specifies the sequence flow to start.

type.description:
**Mandatory**. One of the following values: `cancel`, `startBeforeActivity`, `startAfterActivity`, `startTransition`.

* A cancel instruction requests cancellation of a single activity instance or all instances of one activity.
* A startBeforeActivity instruction requests to enter a given activity.
* A startAfterActivity instruction requests to execute the single outgoing sequence flow of a given activity.
* A startTransition instruction requests to execute a specific sequence flow.

cancelCurrentActiveActivityInstances.description: Can be used with instructions of type cancel. Prevents the deletion of new created activity instances.

duedate.description: The date to set when the job has the next execution.

cascade.description:
A boolean value to indicate if modifications to the due date should cascade to
subsequent jobs. (e.g. Modify the due date of a timer by +15
minutes. This flag indicates if a +15 minutes should be applied to all
subsequent timers.) This flag only affects timer jobs and only works if due date
is not null. Default: `false`

userId.description: The id of the user that does not have expected permissions

canceled.description:
The total number of all canceled instances of the activity. **Note:** Will be `0`
(not `null`), if canceled activity instances were excluded.

resolvedIncidents.description:
The total number of resolved incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

instances.description: The total number of all running instances of the activity.

finished.description:
The total number of all finished instances of the activity. **Note:** Will be `0`
(not `null`), if finished activity instances were excluded.

id.description: The id of the activity the results are aggregated for.

openIncidents.description:
The total number of open incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

deletedIncidents.description:
The total number of deleted incidents for the activity. **Note:** Will be `0` (not
`null`), if `incidents` is set to `false`.

completeScope.description:
The total number of all instances which completed a scope of the activity.
**Note:** Will be `0` (not `null`), if activity instances which
completed a scope were excluded.

finishedDecisionInstanceCount.description: The count of the finished historic decision instances.

decisionDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionName.description: The name of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the decision definition.

cleanableDecisionInstanceCount.description:
The count of the cleanable historic decision instances, referring to history time
to live.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision definition.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the decision definition.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision definition.

resource.description: The file name of the decision requirements definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision requirements definition.

name.description: The name of the decision requirements definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decisionrequirements definition.

id.description: The id of the decision requirements definition

category.description: The category of the decision requirements definition.

version.description: The version of the decision requirements definition that the engine assigned to it.

key.description: The key of the decision requirements definition, i.e., the id of the DMN 1.0 XML decision definition.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The first name of the user.

id.description: The id of the user.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the comment is related to.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing the task.

id.description: The id of the task comment.

time.description:
The time when the comment was created.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

userId.description: The id of the user who created the comment.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the comment belongs.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the comment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format]($(docsUrl)/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

priority.description:
The new execution priority number for jobs of the given definition. The
definition's priority can be reset by using the value `null`. In
that case, the job definition's priority no longer applies but a new
job's priority is determined as specified in the process model.

includeJobs.description:
A boolean value indicating whether existing jobs of the given definition should
receive the priority as well. Default value is `false`. Can only be
`true` when the __priority__ parameter is not `null`.

clearedRemovalTime.description:
Sets the removal time to `null`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

calculatedRemovalTime.description:
The removal time is calculated based on the engine's configuration settings. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `absoluteRemovalTime` or `clearedRemovalTime`.

absoluteRemovalTime.description:
The date for which the instances shall be removed. Value may not be `null`.

**Note:** Cannot be set in conjunction with `clearedRemovalTime` or `calculatedRemovalTime`.

@class.description:
The fully qualified class name of the data transfer object class.
The class name might change in future releases.

instances.description: The total number of running process instances of this process definition.

failedJobs.description:
The total number of failed jobs for the running instances.
**Note**: Will be `0` (not `null`), if failed jobs were excluded.

incidents.description:
Each item in the resulting array is an object which contains `incidentType` and `incidentCount`.
**Note**: Will be an empty array, if `incidents` or `incidentsForType` were excluded.
Furthermore, the array will be also empty if no incidents were found.

id.description: The id of the process definition the results are aggregated for.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this variable instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance that this variable instance belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution that this variable instance belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The id of the case execution that this variable instance belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance that this variable instance belongs to.

name.description: The name of the variable instance.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this variable instance belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

id.description: The id of the variable instance.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that this variable instance belongs to.

batchId.description: The id of the batch that this variable instance belongs to.<

taskId.description: The id of the task that this variable instance belongs to.

evaluations.description: A number of evaluation for decision definition.

allOf.description:
Defines by which selection criterion to activate or suspend job definitions.
The selection criteria are mutually exclusive and can only be one of:
* `processDefinitionId`
* `processDefinitionKey`

processDefinitionId.description: The process definition id of the job definitions to activate or suspend.

processDefinitionWithoutTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend job definitions of a process definition which belongs to
no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

Note that this parameter will only be considered 
in combination with `processDefinitionKey`.

processDefinitionTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend job definitions of a process definition which belongs to a
tenant with the given id.

Note that this parameter will only be considered 
in combination with `processDefinitionKey`.

processDefinitionKey.description: The process definition key of the job definitions to activate or suspend.

dueDate.description:
The due date to set for the job. A due date indicates when this job is ready for execution.
Jobs with due dates in the past will be scheduled for execution.

ActivityInstanceDto.description: A JSON object corresponding to the Activity Instance tree of the given process instance.

childTransitionInstances.description:
A list of child transition instances.
A transition instance represents an execution waiting in an asynchronous continuation.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance this activity instance is part of.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

activityId.description: The id of the activity.

name.description: The name of the activity. This property is deprecated. Please use 'activityName'.

incidents.description:
A list of JSON objects containing incident specific properties:
* `id`: the id of the incident
* `activityId`: the activity id in which the incident occurred

id.description: The id of the activity instance.

activityType.description: The type of activity (corresponds to the XML element name in the BPMN 2.0, e.g., 'userTask')

childActivityInstances.description: A list of child activity instances.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

name.description: The name of the task attachment.

description.description: The description of the task attachment.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process containing the task.

id.description: The id of the task attachment.

type.description:
Indication of the type of content that this attachment refers to.
Can be MIME type or any other indication.

taskId.description: The id of the task to which the attachment belongs.

url.description: The url to the remote content of the task attachment.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the attachment should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

incidentCount.description: The total number of incidents for the corresponding incident type.

incidentType.description:
The type of the incident the number of incidents is aggregated for.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this decision instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance that this decision instance belongs to.

rootDecisionInstanceId.description:
The decision instance id of the evaluated root decision. Can be `null` if this
instance is the root decision instance of the evaluation.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition that this decision instance belongs to.

ouputs.description:
The list of decision output values. **Only exists** if `includeOutputs`
was set to `true` in the query.

inputs.description:
The list of decision input values. **Only exists** if `includeInputs`
was set to `true` in the query.

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition that this decision instance belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance that this decision instance belongs to.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that this decision instance belongs to.

evaluationTime.description:
The time the instance was evaluated. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

userId.description:
The id of the authenticated user that has evaluated this decision instance without
a process or case instance.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this decision instance belongs to.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this decision instance belongs to.

decisionDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description:
The id of the decision requirements definition that this decision instance belongs
to.

decisionDefinitionName.description: The name of the decision definition that this decision instance belongs to.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the historic decision instance.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the evaluation
of this decision. Can be `null` if this decision instance is not
evaluated as part of a BPMN process.

id.description: The id of the decision instance.

collectResultValue.description:
The result of the collect aggregation of the decision result if used. `null` if no
aggregation was used.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description:
The key of the decision requirements definition that this decision instance belongs
to.

deletions.description: An array of String keys of variables to be deleted.

modifications.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

authenticatedUserPassword.description:
The password of the authenticated user who changes the password of the user
(i.e., the user with passed id as path parameter).

features.description: A map of features included in the license.

unlimited.description: Flag that indicates if the license is unlimited.

valid-until.description: The expiration date of the license.

type.description: The license type.

customer.description: The name of the customer the license was issued for.

workerId.description:
**Mandatory.** The ID of the worker who is performing the operation on the external task.
If the task is already locked, must match the id of the worker who has most recently
locked the task.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter tasks based on process definition id.

variables.description:
A JSON array of `String` values that represent variable names. For each result task belonging to this
topic, the given variables are returned as well if they are accessible from the external task's
execution. If not provided - all variables will be fetched.

includeExtensionProperties.description:
Determines whether custom extension properties defined in the BPMN activity of the external task (e.g.
via the Extensions tab in the Camunda modeler) should be included in the response. Default: false

lockDuration.description: **Mandatory.** The duration to lock the external tasks for in milliseconds.

processDefinitionKeyIn.description: Filter tasks based on process definition keys.

processDefinitionIdIn.description: Filter tasks based on process definition ids.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter tasks based on process definition key.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: Filter tasks based on process definition version tag.

localVariables.description: If `true` only local variables will be fetched.

deserializeValues.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default `false`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature. Note
that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format. For example, a
variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

tenantIdIn.description: Filter tasks based on tenant ids.

businessKey.description: A `String` value which enables the filtering of tasks based on process instance business key.

processVariables.description:
A `JSON` object used for filtering tasks based on process instance variable values. A property name of
the object represents a process variable name, while the property value represents the process variable
value to filter tasks by.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

executionId.description: The execution that is subscribed on the referenced event.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance this subscription belongs to.

activityId.description:
The identifier of the activity that this event subscription belongs to.
This could for example be the id of a receive task.

createdDate.description: The time this event subscription was created.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this event subscription belongs to.
Can be `null` if the subscription belongs to no single tenant.

eventName.description: The name of the event this subscription belongs to as defined in the process model.

id.description: The id of the event subscription.

eventType.description: The type of the event subscription.

skipIoMappings.description:
A boolean value to control whether input/output mappings should be executed during
migration.

processInstanceIds.description: A list of process instance ids to migrate.

skipCustomListeners.description:
A boolean value to control whether execution listeners should be invoked during
migration.

TaskQueryDto.description: A Task query which defines a group of Tasks.

maxPriority.description: Restrict to tasks that have a lower or equal priority.

dueAfter.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.435+0200`.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableName` and `variablename` are treated as equal.

assigneeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression is assigned to. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

caseDefinitionKey.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

dueDate.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

createdAfterExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

processInstanceIdIn.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given ids.

processDefinitionName.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given name.

involvedUserExpression.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

unassigned.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

descriptionLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter
value as a substring.

caseDefinitionName.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given name.

assigneeNotIn.description: Only include tasks which are not assigned to one of the passed and comma-separated user ids.

includeAssignedTasks.description:
Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only 
include tasks that are not assigned to any user if you query by candidate user or
group(s).

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated 
tenant ids.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableValue` and `variablevalue` are treated as equal.

caseInstanceBusinessKeyLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case instance business key that has the parameter value 
as a substring.

taskDefinitionKeyLike.description: Restrict to tasks that have a key that has the parameter value as a substring.

caseDefinitionNameLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case definition name that has the parameter value as a 
substring.

assigneeLikeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter value described by the 
given expression as a substring. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

processInstanceId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given id.

processDefinitionId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given id.

processDefinitionNameLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process definition name that has the parameter value as 
a substring.

caseExecutionId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case execution with the given id.

candidateGroupExpression.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the group described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

caseDefinitionId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given id.

assigneeLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

active.description:
Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.

priority.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

suspended.description:
Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

candidateGroup.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given group.

followUpDate.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

executionId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to an execution with the given id.

taskDefinitionKey.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

candidateUser.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given user or to one of his groups.

orQueries.description:
A JSON array of nested task queries with OR semantics. A task matches a nested query if it fulfills
*at least one* of the query's predicates. With multiple nested queries, a task must fulfill at least one predicate of *each* query ([Conjunctive Normal Form](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunctive_normal_form)).

All task query properties can be used except for: `sorting`, `withCandidateGroups`,
`withoutCandidateGroups`, `withCandidateUsers`, `withoutCandidateUsers`

See the [User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-engine-api/#or-queries)
for more information about OR queries.

processInstanceBusinessKeyLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

dueBeforeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

candidateGroups.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the given candidate groups. Takes a
comma-separated list of group names, so for example
`developers,support,sales`.

name.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

withoutDueDate.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

assigned.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

taskDefinitionKeyIn.description: Restrict to tasks that have one of the given keys. The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

assignee.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user is assigned to.

followUpBeforeOrNotExistent.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.432+0200`. The typical use case
is to query all `active` tasks for a user for a given date.

updatedAfterExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the date described by the given expression. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

updatedAfter.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the given date. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

candidateGroupsExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the candidate groups described by the
given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to
`java.util.List` of Strings.

withCandidateGroups.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parentTaskId.description: Restrict query to all tasks that are sub tasks of the given task. Takes a task id.

description.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

dueBefore.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.243+0200`.

processInstanceBusinessKeyLikeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring and is described by an expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

taskIdIn.description: Restrict to tasks with any of the given ids.

candidateUserExpression.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the user described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

createdOn.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.324+0200`.

withoutCandidateGroups.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

followUpDateExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

followUpAfter.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.542+0200`.

processDefinitionKey.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given key.

delegationState.description:
Restrict to tasks that are in the given delegation state. Valid values are
`PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

dueDateExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the date described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

followUpBefore.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
