the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.234+0200`.

nameNotLike.description:
Restrict to tasks that do not have a name with the given parameter
value as substring.

processInstanceBusinessKey.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key.

followUpBeforeOrNotExistentExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the date
described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

dueAfterExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

minPriority.description: Restrict to tasks that have a higher or equal priority.

owner.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

caseInstanceBusinessKey.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given business key.

withoutCandidateUsers.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate users. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

processInstanceBusinessKeyExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key which 
is described by an expression. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

processDefinitionKeyIn.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with one of the given keys. The 
keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

caseInstanceId.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given id.

ownerExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression owns. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

nameNotEqual.description: Restrict to tasks that do not have the given name.

followUpAfterExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

processInstanceBusinessKeyIn.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with one of the give business keys. 
The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

createdAfter.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

followUpBeforeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

assigneeIn.description: Only include tasks which are assigned to one of the passed and comma-separated user ids.

nameLike.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated activity 
instance ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include tasks which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

involvedUser.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

createdBefore.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

withCandidateUsers.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate user. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

createdOnExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

taskId.description: Restrict to task with the given id.

createdBeforeExpression.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

messageName.description: The name of the message to correlate. Corresponds to the 'name' element of the message defined in BPMN 2.0 XML. Can be null to correlate by other criteria only.

variables.description: All variables the operation will set in the root scope of the process instances the message is correlated to.

processInstanceIds.description:
A list of process instance ids that define a group of process instances
to which the operation will correlate a message.

Please note that if `processInstanceIds`, `processInstanceQuery` and `historicProcessInstanceQuery`
are defined, the resulting operation will be performed on the union of these sets.

batchId.description: If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this batch.

processDefinitionKey.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to process
definitions with this key.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

deploymentId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this
deployment.

property.description: The property changed by this operation.

operationId.description:
The unique identifier of this operation. A composite operation that changes
multiple properties has a common `operationId`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this entry.

id.description: The unique identifier of this log entry.

annotation.description: An arbitrary annotation set by a user for auditing reasons.

newValue.description: The new value of the changed property.

processDefinitionId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this process
definition.

processInstanceId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this process
instance.

caseExecutionId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this case
execution.

jobDefinitionId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this job
definition.

caseDefinitionId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this case
definition.

entityType.description:
The type of the entity on which this operation was executed, e.g., `Task` or
`Attachment`.

caseInstanceId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this case
instance.

userId.description: The user who performed this operation.

executionId.description:
If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this
execution.

jobId.description: If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this job.

orgValue.description: The original value of the changed property.

operationType.description: The type of this operation, e.g., `Assign`, `Claim` and so on.

category.description:
The name of the category this operation was associated with, e.g., `TaskWorker` or
`Admin`.

externalTaskId.description: If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this external task.

taskId.description: If not `null`, the operation is restricted to entities in relation to this task.

configuration.description: A configuration for the new incident.

incidentType.description: A type of the new incident.

message.description: A message for the new incident.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the task belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the task belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The id of the case execution the task belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition the task belongs to.

formKey.description: If not `null`, the form key for the task.

created.description:
The date the task was created on.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

parentTaskId.description: The id the parent task, if this task is a subtask.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance the task belongs to.

suspended.description: Whether the task belongs to a process instance that is suspended.

delegationState.description: The task's delegation state. Possible values are `PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

lastUpdated.description:
The date the task was last updated. Every action that fires a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) will update this property.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

followUp.description:
The follow-up date for the task.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

executionId.description: The id of the execution the task belongs to.

name.description: The task name.

tenantId.description: If not `null`, the tenant id of the task.

id.description: The task id.

camunda-integration.description: List of Camunda integrations used (e.g., Camunda Spring Boot Starter, Camunda Run, WildFly/JBoss subsystem, Camunda EJB).

data-collection-start-date.description: The date when the engine started to collect dynamic data, such as command executions and metrics. If telemetry sending is enabled, dynamic data resets on sending the data to Camunda. Dynamic data and the date returned by this method are reset in three cases: engine startup, after engine start when sending telemetry data to Camunda is enabled via API, after sending telemetry data to Camunda (only when this was enabled) The date is in the format YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ.

webapps.description: The webapps enabled in this installation of Camunda.

metrics.description: The collected metrics are the number of root process instance executions started, the number of activity instances started or also known as flow node instances, and the number of executed decision instances and elements.

commands.description: The count of executed commands after the last retrieved data.

HistoricExternalTaskLogQueryDto.description: A Historic External Task Log instance query which defines a list of Historic External Task Log instances

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by process definition id.

workerId.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

deletionLog.description: Only include deletion logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

creationLog.description: Only include creation logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

successLog.description: Only include success logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

errorMessage.description: Filter by external task exception message.

executionIdIn.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed execution ids.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by process definition key.

failureLog.description: Only include failure logs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority lower than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include logs for which the associated external task had a priority higher than or
equal to the given value. Value must be a valid `long` value.

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include historic external task log entries which belong to one of the passed and
comma-separated tenant ids.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity
instance ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

topicName.description: Filter by an external task topic.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic external task log entries that belong to no tenant. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

logId.description: Filter by historic external task log id.

activityIdIn.description: Only include historic external task logs which belong to one of the passed activity ids.

details.description: A JSON Object containing list of errors and warnings occurred during deployment.

decisionInstanceId.description: The id of the decision instance the input value belongs to.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

clauseName.description: The name of the clause the input value belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent
properties.

For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are
returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type
name.

* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store
the variable.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this entry.

id.description: The id of the decision input value.

clauseId.description: The id of the clause the input value belongs to.

type.description: The value type of the variable.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the `disableCustomObjectDeserialization` parameter.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

errorMessage.description: An error message that describes the error.

errorCode.description:
An error code that indicates the predefined error. It is used to identify the BPMN
error handler.

AnyValue.description:
Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.
 **Note**: Not every endpoint supports every type.

variableName.description: The name of the output variable.

decisionInstanceId.description: The id of the decision instance the output value belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent
properties.

For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are
returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type
name.

* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store
the variable.

clauseId.description: The id of the clause the output value belongs to.

type.description: The value type of the variable.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the entry should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

createTime.description:
The time the variable was inserted. 
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

clauseName.description: The name of the clause the output value belongs to.

ruleOrder.description: The order of the rule the output value belongs to.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this entry.

id.description: The id of the decision output value.

ruleId.description: The id of the rule the output value belongs to.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the `disableCustomObjectDeserialization` parameter.

withVariablesInReturn.description:
Indicates if the variables, which was used by the process instance during execution, should be returned.
Default value: `false`

skipIoMappings.description:
Skip execution of
[input/output variable mappings](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#input-output-variable-mapping)
for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.
**Note**: This option is currently only respected when start instructions are submitted
via the `startInstructions` property.

caseInstanceId.description: The case instance id the process instance is to be initialized with.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

startInstructions.description:
**Optional**. A JSON array of instructions that specify which activities to start the process instance at.
If this property is omitted, the process instance starts at its default blank start event.

skipCustomListeners.description:
Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.
**Note**: This option is currently only respected when start instructions are submitted
via the `startInstructions` property.

data.description:
The binary data to be set.
For File variables, this multipart can contain the filename, binary value and MIME type of the file variable to be set
Only the filename is mandatory.

valueType.description: The name of the variable type. Either Bytes for a byte array variable or File for a file variable.

id.description: The id of the schema log entry.

timestamp.description: The date and time of the schema update.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

withVariablesInReturn.description:
Indicates whether the response should contain the process variables or not. The
default is `false` with a response code of `204`. If set to `true` the response
contains the process variables and has a response code of `200`. If the task is not
associated with a process instance (e.g. if it's part of a case instance) no
variables will be returned.

operator.description: Comparison operator to be used. `notLike` is not supported by all endpoints.

bpmn20Xml.description:
An escaped XML string containing the XML that this definition was deployed with.
Carriage returns, line feeds and quotation marks are escaped.

id.description: The id of the process definition.

name.description: The name of the process engine.

groupUsers.description: An array that contains all users that are member in one of the groups.

JobDefinitionQueryDto.description: A Job definition query which defines a list of Job definitions

processDefinitionId.description: Only include job definitions which exist for the given process definition id.

withOverridingJobPriority.description:
Only include job definitions that have an overriding job priority defined. The only
effective value is `true`. If set to `false`, this filter is not applied.

active.description:
Only include active job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

suspended.description:
Only include suspended job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

processDefinitionKey.description: Only include job definitions which exist for the given process definition key.

includeJobDefinitionsWithoutTenantId.description:
Include job definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with
`tenantIdIn`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include job definitions which belong to one of the passed tenant
ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include job definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

jobConfiguration.description:
Only include job definitions which exist for the given job configuration. For example: for
timer jobs it is the timer configuration.

jobType.description:
Only include job definitions which exist for the given job type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job types.

activityIdIn.description: Only include job definitions which belong to one of the passed activity ids.

variables.description: The id of the process instance.

activityId.description: The activity id in which the incident happened.

id.description: The id of the incident.

taskCount.description: The number of tasks which have the group name as candidate group.

groupName.description: The name of the candidate group. If there are tasks without a group name, the value will be `null`

callingProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the calling process definition

calledFromActivityIds.description: Ids of the CallActivities which call this process.

annotation.description: An arbitrary text annotation set by a user for auditing reasons.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition for the modification

instructions.description: An array of modification instructions. The instructions are executed in the order they are in.

skipIoMappings.description:
Skip execution of [input/output variable mappings](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#input-output-variable-mapping) for
activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

skipCustomListeners.description:
Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part
of this request.

processInstanceIds.description: A list of process instance ids to modify.

VariableInstanceQueryDto.description: A variable instance query which defines a list of variable instances

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableName** and **variablename** are treated as equal.

executionIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed 
execution ids.

caseInstanceIdIn.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed  case instance ids.

processInstanceIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed 
process instance ids.

taskIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed  task
ids.

variableValues.description:
An array to only include variable instances that have the certain values.
The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator` and `value`. `name (String)` is the
variable name, `operator (String)` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.
`value` may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater
than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed 
tenant ids.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed 
activity instance ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is an object that specifies one ordering.
                      The position in the array identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary, etc.
                      Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to
`true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

batchIdIn.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed 
batch ids.

variableNameLike.description:
Filter by the variable instance name. The parameter can include the wildcard `%` to
express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or
contains (`%`name`%`).

variableScopeIdIn.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of passed scope ids.

caseExecutionIdIn.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed  case execution ids.

resource.description: The file name of the decision definition.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description: The id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the decision definition.

name.description: The name of the decision definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the decision definition.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the decision definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

versionTag.description: The version tag of the decision definition.

id.description: The id of the decision definition

category.description: The category of the decision definition.

version.description: The version of the decision definition that the engine assigned to it.

key.description: The key of the decision definition, i.e., the id of the DMN 1.0 XML decision definition.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description: The key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

HistoricDecisionInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic decision instance query which defines a list of historic decision instances

decisionInstanceIdIn.description: Filter by decision instance ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision instance ids.

decisionDefinitionKeyIn.description:
Filter by the keys of the decision definition the instances belongs to. Must be a comma-
separated list of decision definition keys.

evaluatedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

caseDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the case definition the instances belongs to.

decisionDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances belongs to.

disableCustomObjectDeserialization.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

includeInputs.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

disableBinaryFetching.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

decisionDefinitionId.description: Filter by the decision definition the instances belongs to.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A historic decision instance must have one
of the given tenant ids.

decisionDefinitionName.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to.

rootDecisionInstancesOnly.description:
Restrict to instances those are the root decision instance of an evaluation.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

activityIdIn.description:
Filter by the activity ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity ids.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the instances belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the process instance the instances belongs to.

rootDecisionInstanceId.description:
Restrict to instances that have a given root decision instance id.
This also includes the decision instance with the given id.

decisionDefinitionIdIn.description:
Filter by the decision definitions the instances belongs to. Must be a
comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

caseDefinitionId.description: Filter by the case definition the instances belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: Filter by the case instance the instances belongs to.

evaluatedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

includeOutputs.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

decisionDefinitionNameLike.description:
Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to, that the parameter
is a substring of.

userId.description: Restrict to instances that were evaluated by the given user.

decisionRequirementsDefinitionId.description: Filter by the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

activityInstanceIdIn.description:
Filter by the activity instance ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity instance ids.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic decision instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

contextPath.description:
The context path of the process application. If the task (or the process definition) does not
belong to a process application deployment or a process definition at all, this
property is not set.

remainingJobs.description:
The number of remaining batch execution jobs. This does include failed batch execution jobs and
batch execution jobs which still have to be created by the seed job.

failedJobs.description: The number of failed batch execution jobs. This does not include aborted or deleted batch execution jobs.

completedJobs.description: The number of completed batch execution jobs. This does include aborted/deleted batch execution jobs.

result.description: The current sum (count) for the selected metric.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance which execution created the job.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition which this job belongs to.

jobDefinitionId.description: The id of the associated job definition.

dueDate.description: The date on which this job is supposed to be processed.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the job is suspended or not.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition which this job belongs to.

executionId.description: The specific execution id on which the job was created.

retries.description: The number of retries this job has left.

createTime.description: The date on which this job has been created.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant which this job belongs to.

id.description: The id of the job.

exceptionMessage.description:
The message of the exception that occurred, the last time the job was executed. Is
null when no exception occurred.

failedActivityId.description:
The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred, the last time the job
was executed. Is null when no exception occurred.

executionDate.description:
The date on which the referenced job definitions will be activated or suspended. If null,
the suspension state of the given job definitions is updated
immediately. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

includeJobs.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether to activate or suspend also all jobs of
the referenced job definitions. When the value is set to `true`, all jobs
of the provided job definitions will be activated or suspended and
when the value is set to `false`, the suspension state of all jobs
of the provided job definitions will not be updated.

name.description: The name of the product (i.e., Camunda BPM Runtime).

edition.description: The edition of the product (i.e., either community or enterprise).

version.description: The version of the process engine (i.e., 7.X.Y).

activityId.description: Can be used with instructions of types `startTransition`. Specifies the sequence flow to start.

transitionId.description: Can be used with instructions of types `startTransition`. Specifies the sequence flow to start.

ancestorActivityInstanceId.description:
Can be used with instructions of type `startBeforeActivity`, `startAfterActivity`, and `startTransition`.
Valid values are the activity instance IDs supplied by the Get Activity Instance request.
If there are multiple parent activity instances of the targeted activity,
this specifies the ancestor scope in which hierarchy the activity/transition is to be instantiated.

Example: When there are two instances of a subprocess and an activity contained in the subprocess is to be started,
this parameter allows to specifiy under which subprocess instance the activity should be started.

transitionInstanceId.description:
Can be used with instructions of type `cancel`. Specifies the transition instance to cancel.
Valid values are the transition instance IDs supplied by the [Get Activity Instance request](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-instance/get-activity-instances/).

activityInstanceId.description:
Can be used with instructions of type `cancel`. Specifies the activity instance to cancel.
Valid values are the activity instance IDs supplied by the [Get Activity Instance request](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-instance/get-activity-instances/).

type.description:
**Mandatory**. One of the following values: `cancel`, `startBeforeActivity`, `startAfterActivity`, `startTransition`.

* A cancel instruction requests cancellation of a single activity instance or all instances of one activity.
* A startBeforeActivity instruction requests to enter a given activity.
* A startAfterActivity instruction requests to execute the single outgoing sequence flow of a given activity.
* A startTransition instruction requests to execute a specific sequence flow.

cancelCurrentActiveActivityInstances.description: Can be used with instructions of type cancel. Prevents the deletion of new created activity instances.

displayName.description: The displayName is generated from the id or firstName and lastName if available.

id.description: The id of the user.

resource.description: The file name of the case definition.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the case definition.

name.description: The name of the case definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the case definition.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the case definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

id.description: The id of the case definition

category.description: The category of the case definition.

version.description: The version of the case definition that the engine assigned to it.

key.description: The key of the case definition, i.e., the id of the CMMN 2.0 XML case definition.

executionId.description:
Optionally specifies a single execution which is notified by the signal.

**Note**: If no execution id is defined the signal is broadcasted to all subscribed
handlers.

variables.description:
A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and
each value a JSON variable value object.

name.description:
The name of the signal to deliver.

**Note**: This property is mandatory.

tenantId.description:
Specifies a tenant to deliver the signal. The signal can only be received on
executions or process definitions which belongs to the given tenant.

**Note**: Cannot be used in combination with executionId.

withoutTenantId.description:
If true the signal can only be received on executions or process definitions which
belongs to no tenant. Value may not be false as this is the default behavior.

**Note**: Cannot be used in combination with `executionId`.

count.description: An integer value representing the count for this metric.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition.

cleanableProcessInstanceCount.description:
The count of the cleanable historic process instances, referring to history time to
live.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process definition.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the process definition.

finishedProcessInstanceCount.description: The count of the finished historic process instances.

processDefinitionName.description: The name of the process definition.

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process definition.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition.

resourceId.description: The id of the resource for which the permission check was performed.

authorized.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the user is authorized or not.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource for which the permission check was performed.

permissionName.description: Name of the permission which was checked.

name.description: The name of the group.

id.description: The id of the group.

retries.description:
A number of how often the task should be retried. Must be >= 0. If this is 0, an incident is created and
the task cannot be fetched anymore unless the retries are increased again. The incident's message is set
to the `errorMessage` parameter.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

localVariables.description: A JSON object containing local variable key-value pairs. Local variables are set only in the scope of external task. Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object with the following properties:

retryTimeout.description: A timeout in milliseconds before the external task becomes available again for fetching. Must be >= 0.

errorMessage.description: An message indicating the reason of the failure.

historicProcessInstanceIds.description: A list historic process instance ids to delete.

failIfNotExists.description: If set to `false`, the request will still be successful if one ore more of the process ids are not found.

instructions.description:
**Optional**. A JSON array of instructions that specify which activities to start the process instance at.
If this property is omitted, the process instance starts at its default blank start event.

withoutBusinessKey.description: Do not take over the business key of the historic process instance.

skipIoMappings.description:
Skip execution of
[input/output variable mappings](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#input-output-variable-mapping)
for activities that are started as part of this request.

initialVariables.description: Set the initial set of variables during restart. By default, the last set of variables is used.

processInstanceIds.description: A list of process instance ids to restart.

skipCustomListeners.description: Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started as part of this request.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance associated with the process instance.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

ended.description: A flag indicating whether the process instance has ended or not. Deprecated: will always be false!

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process instance.

id.description: The id of the process instance.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the process instance is suspended or not.

definitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definitions to activate or suspend.

executionDate.description:
The date on which all process definitions with the given key will be activated or suspended.
If `null`, the suspension state of all process definitions with the given key is updated immediately.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

includeProcessInstances.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether to activate or suspend also all process instances of 
the process definitions with the given key.
When the value is set to `true`, all process instances of the process definitions with the given key
will be activated or suspended and when the value is set to `false`, the suspension state of 
all process instances of the process definitions with the given key will not be updated.

suspended.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether to activate or suspend all process definitions with the given key.
When the value is set to `true`, all process definitions with the given key will be suspended and
when the value is set to `false`, all process definitions with the given key will be activated.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definitions to activate or suspend.

annotation.description: The annotation set to the incident.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition this incident is associated with.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance this incident is associated with.

jobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id the incident is associated with.

causeIncidentId.description: The id of the associated cause incident which has been triggered.

incidentType.description:
The type of incident, for example: `failedJobs` will be returned in case of an incident which identified
a failed job during the execution of a process instance. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

executionId.description: The id of the execution this incident is associated with.

activityId.description: The id of the activity this incident is associated with.

incidentTimestamp.description:
The time this incident happened. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

rootCauseIncidentId.description: The id of the associated root cause incident which has been triggered.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant this incident is associated with.

id.description: The id of the incident.

failedActivityId.description: The id of the activity on which the last exception occurred.

name.description: The name of the metric.

reporter.description: The reporter of the metric. `null` if the metrics are aggregated by reporter.

value.description: The value of the metric aggregated by the interval.

deployment-name.description: The name for the deployment to be created.

deployment-source.description: The source for the deployment to be created.

deploy-changed-only.description:
A flag indicating whether the process engine should perform duplicate checking on a per-resource basis.
If set to true, only those resources that have actually changed are deployed.
Checks are made against resources included previous deployments of the same name and only against the latest versions of those resources.
If set to true, the option enable-duplicate-filtering is overridden and set to true.

data.description:
The binary data to create the deployment resource.
It is possible to have more than one form part with different form part names for the binary data to create a deployment.

deployment-activation-time.description:
Sets the date on which the process definitions contained in this deployment will be activated. This means that all process
definitions will be deployed as usual, but they will be suspended from the start until the given activation date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

tenant-id.description: The tenant id for the deployment to be created.

enable-duplicate-filtering.description:
A flag indicating whether the process engine should perform duplicate checking for the deployment or not.
This allows you to check if a deployment with the same name and the same resouces already exists and
if true, not create a new deployment but instead return the existing deployment. The default value is false.

targetActivityIds.description: The activity ids from the target process definition being mapped.

sourceActivityIds.description: The activity ids from the source process definition being mapped.

updateEventTrigger.description: Configuration flag whether event triggers defined are going to be updated during migration.

resource.description: The file name of the process definition.

startableInTasklist.description: A flag indicating whether the process definition is startable in Tasklist or not.

description.description: The description of the process definition.

historyTimeToLive.description:
History time to live value of the process definition.
Is used within [History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup).

versionTag.description: The version tag of the process definition.

version.description: The version of the process definition that the engine assigned to it.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the definition is suspended or not.

diagram.description: The file name of the process definition diagram, if it exists.

deploymentId.description: The deployment id of the process definition.

name.description: The name of the process definition.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process definition.

id.description: The id of the process definition

category.description: The category of the process definition.

key.description: The key of the process definition, i.e., the id of the BPMN 2.0 XML process definition.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the external task belongs to.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posesses or posessed the most recent lock.

variables.description:
A JSON object containing a property for each of the requested variables. The key is the variable name,
the value is a JSON object of serialized variable values with the following properties:

lockExpirationTime.description: The date that the task's most recent lock expires or has expired.

errorMessage.description:
The full error message submitted with the latest reported failure executing this task;`null` if no failure
was reported previously or if no error message was submitted

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that the external task belongs to.

priority.description: The priority of the external task.

suspended.description: Whether the process instance the external task belongs to is suspended.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the external task is defined in.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this external task belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution that the external task belongs to.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: The version tag of the process definition the external task is defined in.

retries.description: The number of retries the task currently has left.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant the external task belongs to.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance the external task belongs to.

topicName.description: The topic name of the external task.

id.description: The id of the external task.

errorDetails.description:
The error details submitted with the latest reported failure executing this task.`null` if no failure was
reported previously or if no error details was submitted

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition that this historic detail belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance the historic detail belongs to.

type.description:
The type of the historic detail. Either `formField` for a submitted form field
value or `variableUpdate` for variable updates.

userOperationId.description:
The id of user operation which links historic detail with
[user operation log](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/user-operation-log/)
entries.

fieldValue.description:
The submitted form field value. The value differs depending on the form field's type
and on the `deserializeValue` parameter.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `formField`.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this historic detail belongs to.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the historic detail should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

variableType.description:
The value type of the variable.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this historic detail.

id.description: The id of the historic detail.

value.description:
The variable's value. Value differs depending on the variable's type
and on the deserializeValues parameter.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

fieldId.description:
The id of the form field.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `formField`.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this historic detail belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the historic detail belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The id of the case execution the historic detail belongs to.

variableName.description:
The name of the variable which has been updated.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition that this historic detail belongs to.

initial.description:
Returns `true` for variable updates that contains the initial values of the variables.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance the historic detail belongs to.

valueInfo.description:
A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent properties.
For variables of type `Object`, the following properties are returned:

* `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type name.
* `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store the variable.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

errorMessage.description:
An error message in case a Java Serialized Object
could not be de-serialized.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

variableInstanceId.description:
The id of the associated variable instance.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

revision.description:
The revision of the historic variable update.

**Note:** This property is only set for a `HistoricVariableUpdate` historic details.
In these cases, the value of the `type` property is `variableUpdate`.

executionId.description: The id of the execution the historic detail belongs to.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic detail belongs to.

time.description:
The time when this historic detail occurred. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

taskId.description: The id of the task the historic detail belongs to.

businessKey.description:
The business key the process instance is to be initialized with.
The business key uniquely identifies the process instance in the context of the given process definition.

enableTelemetry.description: Specifies if the telemetry data should be sent or not.

RedeploymentDto.description: A JSON object with the following properties:
RedeploymentDto.title: RedeploymentDto

resourceNames.description: A list of deployment resource names to re-deploy.

source.description: Sets the source of the deployment.

resourceIds.description: A list of deployment resource ids to re-deploy.

HistoricBatchQueryDto.description: Query for the historic batches to set the removal time for.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A batch matches if it has one of the given
tenant ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Has no effect for the `/count` endpoint

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

withoutTenantId.description: Only include batches which belong to no tenant. Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

completed.description:
Filter completed or not completed batches. If the value is
`true`, only completed batches, i.e., end time is set, are
returned. Otherwise, if the value is `false`, only running
batches, i.e., end time is null, are returned.

type.description:
Filter by batch type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

local.description:
Indicates whether the variable should be a local variable or not.
If set to true, the variable becomes a local variable of the execution
entering the target activity.

name.description: The name of the tenant.

id.description: The id of the tenant.

createUserId.description: The id of the user that created the batch.

invocationsPerBatchJob.description:
Every batch execution job invokes the command executed by the batch `invocationsPerBatchJob` times.
E.g., for a process instance migration batch this specifies the number of process instances which are migrated per batch execution job.

totalJobs.description: The total jobs of a batch is the number of batch execution jobs required to complete the batch.

batchJobsPerSeed.description:
The number of batch execution jobs created per seed job invocation.
The batch seed job is invoked until it has created all batch execution jobs required by the batch
(see `totalJobs` property).

seedJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the seed jobs of this batch.

type.description:
The type of the batch.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

suspended.description: Indicates whether this batch is suspended or not.

monitorJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the monitor jobs of this batch.

jobsCreated.description: The number of batch execution jobs already created by the seed job.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the batch.

startTime.description:
The time the batch was started. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information,
please see the [documentation] (https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

executionStartTime.description:
The time the batch execution was started, i.e., at least one batch job has been executed. Default
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information, please see the [documentation]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

id.description: The id of the batch.

batchJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the batch execution jobs of this batch.

skipSubprocesses.description: Skip deletion of the subprocesses related to deleted processes as part of this request.

processInstanceIds.description: A list process instance ids to delete.

skipCustomListeners.description: Skip execution listener invocation for activities that are started or ended as part of this request.

processDefinitionId.description:
The process definition id of the process instances to activate or suspend.

**Note**: This parameter can be used only with combination of `suspended`.

processDefinitionWithoutTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend process instances of a process definition which belongs to no tenant.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

**Note**: This parameter can be used only with combination of `suspended`, `processDefinitionKey`, and `processDefinitionTenantId`.

processDefinitionTenantId.description:
Only activate or suspend process instances of a process definition which belongs to a tenant with the given id.

**Note**: This parameter can be used only with combination of `suspended`, `processDefinitionKey`, and `processDefinitionWithoutTenantId`.

processInstanceIds.description:
A list of process instance ids which defines a group of process instances
which will be activated or suspended by the operation.

**Note**: This parameter can be used only with combination of `suspended`, `processInstanceQuery`, and `historicProcessInstanceQuery`.

processDefinitionKey.description:
The process definition key of the process instances to activate or suspend.

**Note**: This parameter can be used only with combination of `suspended`, `processDefinitionTenantId`, and `processDefinitionWithoutTenantId`.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance on which the associated external task was created.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition which the associated external task belongs to.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posessed the most recent lock.

deletionLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the deletion of the associated
external task.

creationLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the creation of the associated
external task.

successLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the successful execution of the
associated external task.

errorMessage.description: The message of the error that occurred by executing the associated external task.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance on which the associated external task was created.

priority.description: The execution priority the external task had when the log entry was created.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition which the associated external task belongs to.

removalTime.description:
The time after which this log should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.  For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

failureLog.description:
A flag indicating whether this log represents the failed execution of the
associated external task.

retries.description: The number of retries the associated external task has left.

activityId.description: The id of the activity on which the associated external task was created.

executionId.description: The execution id on which the associated external task was created.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this historic external task log entry belongs to.

topicName.description: The topic name of the associated external task.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this log.

id.description: The id of the log entry.

externalTaskId.description: The id of the external task.

timestamp.description: The time when the log entry has been written.

variables.description:
A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. Each key is a variable name and
each value a JSON variable value object.

invocationsPerBatchJob.description:
Every batch execution job invokes the command executed by the batch
`invocationsPerBatchJob` times. E.g., for a process instance
migration batch this specifies the number of process instances
which are migrated per batch execution job.

totalJobs.description:
The total jobs of a batch is the number of batch execution
jobs required to complete the batch.

batchJobsPerSeed.description:
The number of batch execution jobs created per seed job invocation.
The batch seed job is invoked until it has created all batch
execution jobs required by the batch (see `totalJobs` property).

seedJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the seed jobs of this batch.

type.description:
The type of the batch. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the historic batch should be removed by the History Cleanup
job. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

monitorJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the monitor jobs of this batch.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the batch.

startTime.description:
The time the batch was started. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

executionStartTime.description:
The time the batch execution was started, i.e., at least one batch job has been executed. Default format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`. For further information, please see the [documentation]
(https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

id.description: The id of the batch.

endTime.description:
The time the batch ended. Default format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.
For further information, please see the [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)

batchJobDefinitionId.description: The job definition id for the batch execution jobs of this batch.

historicBatchIds.description: The ids of the historic batches to set the removal time for.

historicBatchQuery.description: Query for the historic batches to set the removal time for.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this activity instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance that this activity instance belongs to.

durationInMillis.description: The time the instance took to finish (in milliseconds).

activityName.description: The name of the activity that this object is an instance of.

completeScope.description: If `true`, this activity instance did complete a BPMN 2.0 scope.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this activity instance belongs to.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the activity instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this object is an instance of.

executionId.description: The id of the execution that executed this activity instance.

canceled.description: If `true`, this activity instance is canceled.

calledCaseInstanceId.description: The id of the called case instance. Is only set if the activity is a call activity and the called instance a case instance.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the activity instance.

startTime.description:
The time the instance was started. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process containing this activity instance.

id.description: The id of the activity instance.

assignee.description: The assignee of the task that is associated to this activity instance. Is only set if the activity is a user task.

endTime.description:
The time the instance ended. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

activityType.description: The type of the activity that this object is an instance of.

calledProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the called process instance. Is only set if the activity is a call activity and the called instance a process instance.

taskId.description: The id of the task that is associated to this activity instance. Is only set if the activity is a user task.

parentActivityInstanceId.description: The id of the parent activity instance, for example a sub process instance.

parentTaskId.description: The id of the parent task, if this task is a subtask.

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition the task belongs to.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity that this object is an instance of.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the task belongs to.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the task should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

duration.description: The time the task took to finish (in milliseconds).

followUp.description:
The follow-up date for the task. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

startTime.description:
The time the task was started. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this task.

id.description: The task id.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the task belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the task belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The id of the case execution the task belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition the task belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance the task belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution the task belongs to.

name.description: The task name.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the task instance.

endTime.description:
The time the task ended. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

JobQueryDto.description: A Job instance query which defines a list of Job instances

withRetriesLeft.description:
Only select jobs which have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

dueDates.description: Only select jobs where the due date is lower or higher than the given date.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the jobs run on.

jobIds.description: Filter by a  list of job ids.

activityId.description: Only select jobs which exist for an activity with the given id.

priorityLowerThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

withException.description:
Only select jobs that failed due to an exception. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is
the default behavior.

priorityHigherThanOrEquals.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

tenantIdIn.description: Only include jobs which belong to one of the passed  tenant ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                       an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                       identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                       etc. Does not have an effect for the `count` endpoint.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

createTimes.description: Only select jobs created before or after the given date.

exceptionMessage.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception with the given message.

processInstanceId.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given process instance.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the id of the process definition the jobs run on.

jobDefinitionId.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given job definition.

timers.description:
Only select jobs that are timers. Cannot be used together with `messages`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

active.description: Only include active jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

processInstanceIds.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given  list of process instance ids.

executable.description:
Only select jobs which are executable, i.e., retries > 0 and due date is `null` or due
date is in the past. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

suspended.description: Only include suspended jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

executionId.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given execution.

includeJobsWithoutTenantId.description:
Include jobs which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

messages.description:
Only select jobs that are messages. Cannot be used together with `timers`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include jobs which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

noRetriesLeft.description:
Only select jobs which have no retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

failedActivityId.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception at an activity with the given id.

historyTimeToLive.description:
New value for historyTimeToLive field of the definition.
Can be `null`. Can not be negative.

processDefinitionId.description:
The id of the process definition.

**Note:** This property is only set for a historic task report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `count`.

average.description:
The average duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were
started in the given period.

**Note:** This property is only set for a duration report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `duration`.

period.description:
Specifies a span of time within a year.
**Note:** The period must be interpreted in conjunction with the returned `periodUnit`.

**Note:** This property is only set for a duration report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `duration`.

count.description:
The number of tasks which have the given definition.

**Note:** This property is only set for a historic task report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `count`.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant.

maximum.description:
The greatest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which were
started in the given period.

**Note:** This property is only set for a duration report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `duration`.

taskName.description:
The name of the task. It is only available when the `groupBy` parameter is set to `taskName`.
Else the value is `null`.

**Note:** This property is only set for a historic task report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `count`.

processDefinitionName.description:
The name of the process definition.

**Note:** This property is only set for a historic task report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `count`.

periodUnit.description:
The unit of the given period. Possible values are `MONTH` and `QUARTER`.

**Note:** This property is only set for a duration report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `duration`.

minimum.description:
The smallest duration in milliseconds of all completed process instances which
were started in the given period.

**Note:** This property is only set for a duration report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `duration`.

processDefinitionKey.description:
The key of the process definition.

**Note:** This property is only set for a historic task report object.
In these cases, the value of the `reportType` query parameter is `count`.

failures.description: A list of instruction validation report messages.

historyTimeToLive.description: The history time to live of the batch operation.

batchType.description: The type of the batch operation.

finishedBatchesCount.description: The count of the finished batch operations.

cleanableBatchesCount.description:
The count of the cleanable historic batch operations, referring to history time to
live.

variables.description: A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs.

escalationCode.description:
An escalation code that indicates the predefined escalation. It is used to identify
the BPMN escalation handler.

owner.description: The user id of the owner of the filter.

query.description: The query of the filter as a JSON object.

name.description: The name of the filter.

id.description: The id of the filter.

properties.description: The properties of a filter as a JSON object.

resourceType.description: The resource type of the filter.

itemCount.description:
The number of items matched by the filter itself. Note: Only exists
if the query parameter
`itemCount` was set to `true`

authenticated.description: A flag indicating if user is authenticated.

variables.description: A variables the operation will set in the root scope of the process instances.

processInstanceIds.description:
A list of process instance ids that define a group of process instances
