to which the operation will set variables.

Please note that if `processInstanceIds`, `processInstanceQuery` and `historicProcessInstanceQuery`
are defined, the resulting operation will be performed on the union of these sets.

targetProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the target process definition for the migration.

instructions.description:
A list of migration instructions which map equal activities. Each
migration instruction is a JSON object with the following properties:

variables.description:
A map of variables which will be set into the process instances' scope.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object.

sourceProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the source process definition for the migration.

HistoricProcessInstanceQueryDto.description: A historic process instance query which defines a group of historic process instances

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

subCaseInstanceId.description: Restrict query to one process instance that has a sub case instance with the given id.

incidentType.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

executedActivityAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an activity after the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

processDefinitionName.description: Filter by the name of the process definition the instances run on.

executedJobAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an job after the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

processDefinitionKey.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the instances run on.

withRootIncidents.description: Only include process instances which have a root incident. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

subProcessInstanceId.description: Restrict query to one process instance that has a sub process instance with the given id.

tenantIdIn.description: Filter by a list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`

internallyTerminated.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

processInstanceBusinessKey.description: Filter by process instance business key.

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

processDefinitionKeyNotIn.description: Exclude instances that belong to a set of process definitions. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

unfinished.description: Only include unfinished process instances. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

startedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

executedActivityBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an activity before the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

rootProcessInstances.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are top level process instances.

withIncidents.description: Only include process instances which have an incident. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

incidentStatus.description: Only include process instances which have an incident in status either open or resolved. To get all process instances, use the query parameter withIncidents.

superProcessInstanceId.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given process instance. Takes a process instance id.

processInstanceId.description: Filter by process instance id.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the instances run on.

processDefinitionNameLike.description: Filter by process definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

finishedAfter.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

variables.description:
A JSON array to only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
The array consists of objects with the three properties `name`, `operator` and `value`. `name` (`String`) is the variable name,
`operator` (`String`) is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

Value may be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

incidentMessage.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

activeActivityIdIn.description: Restrict to instances that have an active activity with one of given ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`

processDefinitionKeyIn.description: Filter by a list of process definition keys. A process instance must have one of the given process definition keys. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

startedBy.description: Only include process instances that were started by the given user.

caseInstanceId.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance. Takes a case instance id.

externallyTerminated.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

executedActivityIdIn.description: Restrict to instances that executed an activity with one of given ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`

active.description: Restrict to instances that are active.

finished.description:
Only include finished process instances. This flag includes all process instances
that are completed or terminated. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

completed.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

processInstanceBusinessKeyIn.description: Filter by a list of business keys. A process instance must have one of the given business keys. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`

superCaseInstanceId.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance. Takes a case instance id.

processInstanceIds.description: Filter by process instance ids. Must be a JSON array of `Strings`.

suspended.description: Restrict to instances that are suspended.

orQueries.description:
A JSON array of nested historic process instance queries with OR semantics.

A process instance matches a nested query if it fulfills at least one of the query's predicates.

With multiple nested queries, a process instance must fulfill at least one predicate of each query
([Conjunctive Normal Form](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunctive_normal_form)).

All process instance query properties can be used except for: `sorting`

See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-engine-api/#or-queries) for more information about OR queries.

processInstanceBusinessKeyLike.description: Filter by process instance business key that the parameter is a substring of.

withoutTenantId.description: Only include historic process instances which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

startedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

incidentMessageLike.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

finishedBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

executedJobBefore.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an job before the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

MessageCorrelationResultWithVariableDto.description:
The `processInstance` property only has a value if the resultType is set to `ProcessDefinition`.
The processInstance with the properties as described in the
[get single instance](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-instance/get/) method.

The `execution` property only has a value if the resultType is set to `Execution`.
The execution with the properties as described in the
[get single execution](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/get/) method.

variables.description:
This property is returned if the `variablesInResultEnabled` is set to `true`.
Contains a list of the process variables.

resultType.description:
Indicates if the message was correlated to a message start event or an 
intermediate message catching event. In the first case, the resultType is 
`ProcessDefinition` and otherwise `Execution`.

resourceId.description: The id of the resource that the user is missing permission for.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource that the user is missing permission for.

permissionName.description: The permission name that the user is missing.

rules.description: An array of password policy rules. Each element of the array is representing one rule of the policy.

historicDecisionInstanceIds.description: The ids of the historic decision instances to set the removal time for.

hierarchical.description:
Sets the removal time to all historic decision instances in the hierarchy.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the variable instance belongs to.

processInstanceId.description: The process instance id the variable instance belongs to.

caseExecutionId.description: The case execution id the variable instance belongs to.

caseDefinitionId.description: The id of the case definition the variable instance belongs to.

caseDefinitionKey.description: The key of the case definition the variable instance belongs to.

caseInstanceId.description: The case instance id the variable instance belongs to.

errorMessage.description: An error message in case a Java Serialized Object could not be de-serialized.

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance in which the variable is valid.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the variable instance belongs to.

removalTime.description:
The time after which the variable should be removed by the History Cleanup job.
[Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

executionId.description: The execution id the variable instance belongs to.

createTime.description: The time the variable was inserted. [Default format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

name.description: The name of the variable instance.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant that this variable instance belongs to.

rootProcessInstanceId.description:
The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process
containing this variable.

id.description: The id of the variable instance.

state.description: The current state of the variable. Can be 'CREATED' or 'DELETED'.

taskId.description: The id of the task the variable instance belongs to.

targetProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the target process definition for the migration.

updateEventTriggers.description:
A boolean flag indicating whether instructions between events should be configured
to update the event triggers.

variables.description:
A map of variables which will be set into the process instances' scope.
Each key is a variable name and each value a JSON variable value object.

sourceProcessDefinitionId.description: The id of the source process definition for the migration.

ExternalTaskDto.description: An External Task object with the following properties
ExternalTaskDto.title: ExternalTaskDto

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition the external task is defined in.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the process instance the external task belongs to.

workerId.description: The id of the worker that posesses or posessed the most recent lock.

lockExpirationTime.description: The date that the task's most recent lock expires or has expired.

errorMessage.description:
The full error message submitted with the latest reported failure executing this task; `null` if no
failure was reported previously or if no error message was submitted

activityInstanceId.description: The id of the activity instance that the external task belongs to.

priority.description: The priority of the external task.

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the external task is suspended or not.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition the external task is defined in.

activityId.description: The id of the activity that this external task belongs to.

executionId.description: The id of the execution that the external task belongs to.

processDefinitionVersionTag.description: The version tag of the process definition the external task is defined in.

retries.description: The number of retries the task currently has left.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant the external task belongs to.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance the external task belongs to.

topicName.description: The topic name of the external task.

id.description: The id of the external task.

retries.description:
The number of retries to set for the external task.  Must be >= 0. If this is 0, an incident is created
and the task cannot be fetched anymore unless the retries are increased again. Can not be null.

processInstanceIds.description: The ids of process instances containing the tasks to set the number of retries for.

externalTaskIds.description: The ids of the external tasks to set the number of retries for.

HistoricVariableInstanceQueryDto.description: A Historic Variable Instance instance query which defines a list of Historic Variable Instance instances

processInstanceId.description: Filter by the process instance the variable belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: Filter by the process definition the variable belongs to.

variableTypeIn.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type
'serializable'.

caseActivityIdIn.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and  case activity ids.

variableValue.description: Filter by variable value. May be `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match the variable name provided in `variableName` and `variableNameLike` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

taskIdIn.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and  task ids.

tenantIdIn.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated tenant ids.

activityInstanceIdIn.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and  activity instance ids.

sorting.description:
An array of criteria to sort the result by. Each element of the array is
                     an object that specifies one ordering. The position in the array
                     identifies the rank of an ordering, i.e., whether it is primary, secondary,
                     etc. Sorting has no effect for `count` endpoints

sortOrder.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for
descending order. Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

sortBy.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match the variable value provided in `variableValue` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

withoutTenantId.description:
Only include historic variable instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be

caseExecutionIdIn.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and  case execution ids.

historicProcessInstanceIds.description: The id of the process instance.

hierarchical.description:
Sets the removal time to all historic process instances in the hierarchy.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

name.description: Variable name

version.description: The version of the Rest API.

variableNamesIgnoreCase.description:
Match the variable name provided in `taskVariables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

caseDefinitionKey.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

taskDescription.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

processDefinitionName.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given name.

unassigned.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

tenantIdIn.description:
Filter by a  list of tenant ids. A task instance must have one of the given
tenant ids.

taskFollowUpDateBefore.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

variableValuesIgnoreCase.description:
Match the variable value provided in `taskVariables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

taskHadCandidateGroup.description: Restrict to tasks with a historic identity link to the given candidate group.

taskDueDateAfter.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

taskFollowUpDateAfter.description:

the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

caseExecutionId.description: Filter by the id of the case execution that executed the task.

taskFollowUpDate.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

finished.description: Only include finished tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

orQueries.description:
A JSON array of nested historic task instance queries with OR semantics.

A task instance matches a nested query if it fulfills at least one of the query's predicates.

With multiple nested queries, a task instance must fulfill at least one predicate of each query
([Conjunctive Normal Form](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunctive_normal_form)).

All task instance query properties can be used except for: `sorting`, `withCandidateGroups`, ` withoutCandidateGroups`.

See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-engine-api/#or-queries) for more information about OR queries.

e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

default behavior.

Filter by process instances with one of the give business keys.

mainElementId.description: The main element id where the problem occurred.

line.description: The line where the problem occurred.

column.description: The column where the problem occurred.

elementIds.description: A list of element id affected by the problem.

retries.description:
The number of retries to set for the resource.  Must be >= 0. If this is 0, an incident is created
and the task, or job, cannot be fetched, or acquired anymore unless the retries are increased again.
Can not be null.

allOf.description:
Defines the number of retries for a selection of jobs.
Please note that if both jobIds and jobQuery are provided,
then retries will be set on the union of these sets.

jobIds.description: A list of job ids to set retries for.

separated tenant ids.

deployedProcessDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the process definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the process definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the process definition.

deployedDecisionDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision definition.

deployedCaseDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the case definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the case definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the case definition.

deployedDecisionRequirementsDefinitions.description:
A JSON Object containing a property for each of the decision requirements definitions,
which are successfully deployed with that deployment.
The key is the decision requirements definition id, the value is a JSON Object corresponding to the decision requirements definition.

userId.description: The id of the user that the current action refers to.

links.description: The links associated to this resource, with `method`, `href` and `rel`.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

durationInMillis.description: The time the instance took to finish (in milliseconds).

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

processDefinitionName.description: The name of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

superCaseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

deleteReason.description: The provided delete reason in case the process instance was canceled during execution.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

removalTime.description: The time after which the instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

startUserId.description: The id of the user who started the process instance.

startActivityId.description: The id of the initial activity that was executed (e.g., a start event).

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process instance.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process.

startTime.description: The time the instance was started. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

id.description: The id of the process instance.

endTime.description: The time the instance ended. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

state.description:
Last state of the process instance, possible values are:

`ACTIVE` - running process instance

`SUSPENDED` - suspended process instances

`COMPLETED` - completed through normal end event

`EXTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated externally, for instance through REST API

`INTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated internally, for instance by terminating boundary event

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

superProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the parent process instance, if it exists.

groupId.description: The id of the group participating in this link. Either `groupId` or `userId` is set.

type.description:
The type of the identity link. The value of the this property can be user-defined. The Process Engine
provides three pre-defined Identity Link `type`s:

* `candidate`
* `assignee` - reserved for the task assignee
* `owner` - reserved for the task owner

**Note**: When adding or removing an Identity Link, the `type` property must be defined.

userId.description: The id of the user participating in this link. Either `userId` or `groupId` is set.

processInstanceId.description: The id of the root of the execution tree representing the process instance.

ended.description: Indicates if the execution is ended.

tenantId.description:
The id of the tenant this execution belongs to. Can be `null`
if the execution belongs to no single tenant.

id.description: The id of the Execution.

lockDuration.description:
The duration to lock the external task for in milliseconds.
**Note:** Attempting to lock an already locked external task with the same `workerId`
will succeed and a new lock duration will be set, starting from the current moment.

code.description:
The code allows your client application to identify the error in an automated fashion.
You can look up the meaning of all built-in codes and learn how to add custom codes
in the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/error-handling/#exception-codes).

type.description: An exception class indicating the occurred error.

message.description: A detailed message of the error.

servers.description: The API server for the default process engine
The API server for a named process engine
The API server with a custom url

post.description:
Activates or suspends process instances asynchronously with a list of process instance ids,
a process instance query, and/or a historical process instance query.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the request parameters are invalid,
for example if the provided processDefinitionId or processDefinitionKey parameter is null.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic batches asynchronously (batch).

At least __historicBatchIds__ or __historicBatchQuery__ has to be
provided. If both are provided,
all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list
will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Request was unsuccessful due to a bad user request. This occurs if
some of the query parameters are invalid, e.g. if neither
historicBatchIds nor historicBatchQuery is present or if no mode is
specified.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the key of the start form for the latest version of the process definition
which belongs to no tenant.
The form key corresponds to the `FormData#formKey` property in the engine.

400.description:
Process definition has no start form defined. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) for which the form key is to be retrieved.

get.description:
Requests the number of historic batches that fulfill the query criteria.
Takes the same filtering parameters as the
[Get Historic Batches](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/batch/get-query/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if
a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: Filter by batch id.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter by batch type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description:
Filter completed or not completed batches. If the value is
`true`, only completed batches, i.e., end time is set, are
returned. Otherwise, if the value is `false`, only running
batches, i.e., end time is null, are returned.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A batch matches if it has one of the given
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include batches which belong to no tenant. Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

put.description: Sets the priority of an existing external task by id. The default value of a priority is 0.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task,
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the external task to set the priority for.

post.description:
Delete multiple historic decision instances asynchronously (batch).
At least `historicDecisionInstanceIds` or `historicDecisionInstanceQuery` 
has to be provided. If both are provided then all instances matching query 
criterion and instances from the list will be deleted.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, i.e. neither
`historicDecisionInstanceIds` nor `historicDecisionInstanceQuery` is
present. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) 
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a user's profile.

404.description:
Execution with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

The user could not be updated due to an internal server error. See the

for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

403.description: Identity service is read-only (Cannot modify users / groups / memberships).

404.description: If the user with the requested Id cannot be found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user.

get.description: Retrieves the DMN XML of a decision definition.

value.dmnXml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                                    <definitions xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20151101/dmn.xsd"
                                                 id="definitions"
                                                 name="camunda"
                                                 namespace="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/dmn">
                                      <decision id="testDecision" name="decision">
                                        <decisionTable id="table">
                                          <output id="result" name="result" >
                                          </output>
                                          <rule id="rule">
                                            <outputEntry id="output1">
                                              <text>"not okay"</text>
                                            </outputEntry>
                                          </rule>
                                        </decisionTable>
                                      </decision>
                                    </definitions>

404.description:

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a historic detail by id.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the detail.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically
variables that store custom Java objects) should be deserialized
on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on
server side and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java
classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its
serialized format. For example, a variable that is serialized as
XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of
backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to
`false` when developing web applications that are independent of
the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for a process definition
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
The id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to retrieve the variables for.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

method.

for the error response format.

parameters.description: Filter by decision instance id.

parameters.description: Filter by decision instance ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision instance ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by the decision definitions the instances belongs to. Must be a
comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKey

Filter by the keys of the decision definition the instances belongs to. Must be a comma-
separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionName

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionNameLike

Filter by the name of the decision definition the instances belongs to, that the parameter
is a substring of.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId

parameters.name: processInstanceId

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the case definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the case definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the case instance the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by the activity ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by the activity instance ids the instances belongs to.
Must be a comma-separated list of acitvity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A historic decision instance must have one
of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic decision instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: evaluatedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: evaluatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that were evaluated by the given user.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstanceId
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that have a given root decision instance id.
This also includes the decision instance with the given id.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstancesOnly
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances those are the root decision instance of an evaluation.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

Bad Request

for example if a sortOrder parameter is supplied, but no sortBy, or if an invalid operator for variable comparison is used.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.

parameters.name: maxResults

as false is the default behavior.

for a list of incident types.

parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively.
If set to true variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

get.description: Retrieves a task comment by task id and comment id.

404.description:
The task or comment with given task and comment id does not exist, or the history of
the engine is disabled. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: commentId
parameters.description: The id of the comment to be retrieved.

example-2.description: Logical query: assignee = "John Munda" AND (name = "Approve Invoice" OR priority = 5) AND (suspended = false OR taskDefinitionKey = "approveInvoice")

post.description:
Retrieves the number of tasks that fulfill the given filter. Corresponds to the size
of the result set of the [Get Tasks (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/task/post-query/)
method and takes the same parameters.

**Security Consideration**:
There are several parameters (such as `assigneeExpression`) for specifying an EL
expression. These are disabled by default to prevent remote code execution. See the
section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
in the user guide for details.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves the number of tasks that fulfill a provided filter. Corresponds to the size
of the result set when using the [Get Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/task/) method.

**Security Consideration:** There are several query parameters (such as
assigneeExpression) for specifying an EL expression. These are disabled by default to
prevent remote code execution. See the section on
[security considerations](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
for custom code in the user guide for details.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Restrict to task with the given id.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with any of the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given ids.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with the given business key which 
is described by an expression. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to process instances with one of the give business keys. 
The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process instance business key that has the parameter 
value as a substring and is described by an expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given key.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with one of the given keys. The 
keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a process definition with the given name.

parameters.name: processDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a process definition name that has the parameter value as 
a substring.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to case instances with the given business key.

parameters.name: caseInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case instance business key that has the parameter value 
as a substring.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given id.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given name.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a case definition name that has the parameter value as a 
substring.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case execution with the given id.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated activity 
instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated 
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user is assigned to.

parameters.name: assigneeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression is assigned to. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter 
value as a substring.

parameters.name: assigneeLikeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have an assignee that has the parameter value described by the 
given expression as a substring. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigneeIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are assigned to one of the passed and 
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: assigneeNotIn
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which are not assigned to one of the passed and
comma-separated user ids.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

parameters.name: ownerExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that the user described by the given expression owns. See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateGroup
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given group.

parameters.name: candidateGroupExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the group described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: candidateUser
parameters.description: Only include tasks that are offered to the given user or to one of his groups.

parameters.name: candidateUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that are offered to the user described by the given expression. 
See the 
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions) 
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: includeAssignedTasks
parameters.description:
Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only 
include tasks that are not assigned to any user if you query by candidate user or
group(s).

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

parameters.name: involvedUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have one of the given keys. The keys need to be in a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a key that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

parameters.name: nameNotEqual
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that do not have the given name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

parameters.name: nameNotLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that do not have a name with the given parameter
value as substring.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

parameters.name: descriptionLike
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter
value as a substring.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

parameters.name: maxPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a lower or equal priority.

parameters.name: minPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a higher or equal priority.

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: dueDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the date described by the given expression. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.435+0200`.

parameters.name: dueAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.243+0200`.

parameters.name: dueBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: withoutDueDate
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: followUpDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpDateExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.542+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.234+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistent
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.432+0200`. The
typical use case is to query all `active` tasks for a user for a given date.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistentExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the date
described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have
the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.324+0200`.

parameters.name: createdOnExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created on the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: createdAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: createdBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the given date. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: updatedAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the date described by the given expression. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: delegationState
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are in the given delegation state. Valid values are
`PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

parameters.name: candidateGroups
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the given candidate groups. Takes a
comma-separated list of group names, so for example `developers,support,sales`.

parameters.name: candidateGroupsExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the candidate groups described by the
given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to
`java.util.List` of Strings.

parameters.name: withCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate user. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate users. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: taskVariables
processVariables
caseInstanceVariables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableName` and `variablename` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableValue` and `variablevalue` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all tasks that are sub tasks of the given task. Takes a task id.

example-1.description: Set variables to process instances in a batch

post.description: Update or create runtime process variables in the root scope of process instances.

400.description:
Bad Request
* The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or
the passed variable type is not supported
* If none of `processInstanceIds`, `processInstanceQuery` and `historicProcessInstanceQuery` is given
* If no or an empty array of `variables` is given
* If no process instance ids where found
* If a transient variable is set
* If the engine config flag `javaSerializationFormatEnabled` is `false` and a Java serialized variable is given

403.description:
Returned if the user is not allowed to create the batch.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

post.description: Create a new user.

get.description:
Queries for the number of historic details that fulfill the given parameters.
Takes the same parameters as the [Get Historic
Details](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/detail/get-detail-query/)
method.

400.description: Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by process instance id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic details which belong to one of the passed comma-separated process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Filter by execution id.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Filter by task id.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by activity instance id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by case instance id.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Filter by case execution id.

parameters.name: variableInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance id.

parameters.name: variableTypeIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic details where the variable updates belong to one of the passed comma-separated
list of variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type `serializable`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic details that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: userOperationId
parameters.description: Filter by a user operation id.

parameters.name: formFields
parameters.description: Only include `HistoricFormFields`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: variableUpdates
parameters.description: Only include `HistoricVariableUpdates`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: excludeTaskDetails
parameters.description:
Excludes all task-related `HistoricDetails`, so only items which have no task id set will be selected.
When this parameter is used together with `taskId`, this call is ignored and task details are not excluded.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic variable updates that contain only initial variable values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: occurredBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured before the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: occurredAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to historic details that occured after the given date (including the date).
Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/)
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

get.description:
For the given process, returns a list of called process definitions corresponding
to
the `CalledProcessDefinition` interface in the engine. The list
contains all process definitions
that are referenced statically by call activities in the given
process. This endpoint does not
resolve process definitions that are referenced with expressions. Each
called process definition
contains a list of call activity ids, which specifies the call
activities that are calling that
process. This endpoint does not resolve references to case
definitions.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

get.description: Gets the comments for a task by id.

404.description:
No task exists for the given task id. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the comments for.

get.description:
Queries for the number of deployments that fulfill given parameters. Takes the same parameters as the
[Get Deployments](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/deployment/get-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example, if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment name. Exact match.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the deployment name that the parameter is a substring of. The parameter can include the
wildcard `%` to express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or contains
(`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source.

parameters.name: withoutSource
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source whereby source is equal to `null`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A deployment must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include deployments which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: includeDeploymentsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include deployments which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

get.description:
Retrieves history cleanup batch window configuration (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

Queries for a list of filters using a list of parameters. The size of the result
set can be retrieved
by using the [Get Filter Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/filter/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if
a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy` is specified. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the filter.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Filter by the resource type of the filter, e.g., `Task`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the filter.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by the name that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter by the user id of the owner of the filter.

parameters.name: itemCount
parameters.description:
If set to `true`, each filter result will contain an `itemCount` property
with the number of items matched by the filter itself.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

options.description:
The OPTIONS request allows you to check for the set of available operations 
that the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/filter` resource.
Whether the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various
factors, including the users authorizations to interact with this
resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

get.description:
Retrieves the diagram for the latest version of the process definition for tenant.

If the process definition's deployment contains an image resource with the same file name
as the process definition, the deployed image will be returned by the Get Diagram endpoint.
Example: `someProcess.bpmn` and `someProcess.png`.
Supported file extentions for the image are: `svg`, `png`, `jpg`, and `gif`.

200.description: Request successful. The image diagram of this process.

schema.description: defaults to `application/octet-stream` if the file suffix is unknown
Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

get.description:

Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error
response format.

parameters.name: incidentId

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident
types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value. The string can include
the wildcard character '%' to express like-strategy: starts with (`string%`), ends with (`%string`) or
contains (`%string%`).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given keys. Must be a
comma-separated list.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date before the given date. 
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: incidentTimestampAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an incidentTimestamp date after the given date. 
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date
must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that were created due to the failure of an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: causeIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as cause incident.

parameters.name: rootCauseIncidentId

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as configuration.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated job definition ids.

post.description:
Correlates a message asynchronously to executions that are waiting for this message. 
Messages will not be correlated to process definition-level start message events to start process instances.

400.description:
Bad Request
* If none of `processInstanceIds`, `processInstanceQuery`, and `historicProcessInstanceQuery` is given
* If no process instance ids where found

Returned if the user is not allowed to create the batch.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the

get.description: Retrieves a variable of a given process instance by id.

400.description:
Bad Request
Variable with given id does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to false
when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

Bad Request

the passed variable type is not supported.

parameters.description: The id of the process instance to set the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to set.

get.description:
Requests the number of process definitions that fulfill the query criteria.
