400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by process definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key, i.e., the id in the BPMN 2.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keysIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by process definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by process definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those process definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the process definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those process definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: startableBy
parameters.description: Filter by a user name who is allowed to start the process.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Filter by the incident type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
A process definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include process definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeProcessDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include process definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: withoutVersionTag
parameters.description: Only include process definitions without a `versionTag`.

parameters.name: startableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are startable in Tasklist..

parameters.name: notStartableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are not startable in Tasklist.

parameters.name: startablePermissionCheck
parameters.description:
Filter by process definitions which the user is allowed to start in Tasklist.
If the user doesn't have these permissions the result will be empty list.
The permissions are:
* `CREATE` permission for all Process instances
* `CREATE_INSTANCE` and `READ` permission on Process definition level

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for the latest process definition which belongs to no tenant
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
The key is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

example-1.summary: Restarting one or more Process Instances with known processInstanceIds

example-2.summary: Restarting one or more Process Instances using a historicProcessInstanceQuery

post.description:
Restarts process instances that were canceled or terminated synchronously.
Can also restart completed process instances.
It will create a new instance using the original instance information.
To execute the restart asynchronously, use the
[Restart Process Instance Async](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-definition/post-restart-process-instance-async/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous execution,
please refer to the related section of the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-restart/#execution).

400.description:
In case following parameters are missing: `instructions`, `activityId` or `transitionId`,
`processInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery`, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned. 
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition of the process instances to restart.

post.description:
Query for the number of variable instances that fulfill given parameters. This
method takes the same message body as the
[Get Variable Instances POST](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/variable-
instance/post-query/) method and therefore it is slightly more
powerful than the [Get Variable Instance
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Query for the number of variable instances that fulfill given parameters. Takes the
same parameters as the [Get Variable
Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query/)

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if an invalid operator for variable
comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the variable instance name. The parameter can include the wildcard `%` to
express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or
contains (`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case instance ids.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated task
ids.

parameters.name: batchIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
batch ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variableValues
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances that have the certain values.
Value filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableName** and **variablename** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to
`true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableScopeIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of passed scope ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

put.description: Updates a user's credentials (password)

400.description: The authenticated user password does not match

500.description:

get.description:
Retrieves the deployed form that is referenced from a given task. For further
information please refer to the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#embedded-task-forms).

schema.description: For `application/json` Responses, a byte stream is returned.
For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: (e.g. "Great Pizza for Everyone Inc.")

400.description:
The form key has wrong format. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
The deployed form cannot be retrieved due to missing permissions on task resource.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
No deployed form for a given task exists. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to get the deployed form for.

post.description:

The input values of the decision have to be supplied in the request body.

404.description:
Decision definition with given key does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the decision definition (the latest version thereof) to be evaluated.

requestBody.description: A JSON object which corresponds to the type of the saved query of the filter, i.e., if the resource type of the filter is Task the body should form a valid task query corresponding to the Task resource.

example-1.description: POST `filter/aTaskFilterId/singleResult`. **Note**: The examples show a task filter. So the request body corresponds to a task query. For other resource types the request body will differ.

post.description:
Executes the saved query of the filter by id and returns the single result. This method is slightly more
powerful then the [Get Execute Filter Single Result](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/filter/get-execute-single-result/)
method because it allows to extend the saved query of the filter.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object corresponding to the corresponding entity interface in the engine. This depends on the saved query in the filter. Therefore it is not possible specify a generic result format, i.e., if the resource type of the filter is Task the result will correspond to the Task interface in the engine.

example-1.description: POST `filter/aTaskFilterId/singleResult`. **Note**: The examples show the result of a task filter. So the response corresponds to a task, but for other filters the response format will differ.

400.description:
The executed filter returned more than one single result or the
extending query was invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

for the error response format.

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about a decision definition and finished decision instances
relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)), 
so that you can tune the history time to live.
These reports include the count of the finished historic decision
instances, cleanable decision instances and basic decision definition
data - id, key, name and version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the 
[Get Cleanable Decision Instance Report Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/decision-definition/get-cleanable-decision-instance-report-count/) method.

500.description:
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the
error response format.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition ids.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant 
ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` 
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description:
Only include decision instances which have more than zero finished instances. Value may only be `true`, 
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description: Retrieves the binary content of a task attachment by task id and attachment id.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. Additionally, for file
                            responses, the Content-Disposition header will be set.

404.description:
The attachment content for the given task id and attachment id does not exist, or the history of the
engine is disabled.

See the [Introduction](/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the attachment to be retrieved.

put.description: Activates or suspends a given process definition by id.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if the provided `executionDate` parameter doesn't have the expected format or
if the `processDefinitionKey` parameter is `null`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to activate or suspend.

get.description:
Queries for process definitions that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the properties of 
process definitions, such as the name, key or version. The size of the result set can be retrieved
by using the [Get Definition Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-definition/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by process definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the process definition belongs to.
Only selects process definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.546+0200`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key, i.e., the id in the BPMN 2.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keysIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by process definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by process definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by process definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those process definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the process definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those process definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: startableBy
parameters.description: Filter by a user name who is allowed to start the process.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended process definitions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Filter by the incident type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
A process definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include process definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value may only be true, as false is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeProcessDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include process definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: withoutVersionTag
parameters.description: Only include process definitions without a `versionTag`.

parameters.name: startableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are startable in Tasklist..

parameters.name: notStartableInTasklist
parameters.description: Filter by process definitions which are not startable in Tasklist.

parameters.name: startablePermissionCheck
parameters.description:
Filter by process definitions which the user is allowed to start in Tasklist.
If the user doesn't have these permissions the result will be empty list.
The permissions are:
* `CREATE` permission for all Process instances
* `CREATE_INSTANCE` and `READ` permission on Process definition level

options.description:
The `/tenant` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, this one for the resource
as such and one for individual tenant instances. The OPTIONS request
allows checking for the set of available operations that the currently
authenticated user can perform on the `/tenant` resource. If the user
can perform an operation or not may depend on various things,
including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about a historic batch operations relevant to history cleanup
(see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)
) so that you can tune the history time to live.
These reports include the count of the finished batches, cleanable
batches and type of the batch.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Cleanable Batch Report Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/batch/get-cleanable-batch-report-count/)
method.

**Please note:**
The history time to live for batch operations does not support [Multi-Tenancy](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/multi-tenancy.md).
The report will return an information for all batch operations (for all tenants) if you have permissions
to see the history.

example-1.description:
GET `/history/batch/cleanable-batch-report`

                                      An array containing finished batches information relevant to history cleanup.

post.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. A password can be checked for compliancy via this
end point. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length, and
some complexity rules. The checked password is myPassword which is not complex enough to match all of
the policy rules.

404.description: No password policy was found to check the password against.

get.description:
A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
policy compliant. This end point returns a JSON representation of the
list of policy rules. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
the [security instructions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/security/).

200.description:
Request successful. This example uses the built-in password policy that enforces a minimum password length,
and some complexity rules.

404.description: No password policy was found.

                            for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

post.description:
Executes a modification asynchronously for multiple process instances. To execute a
modification synchronously, use the
[Execute Modification](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/modification/post-modification-sync/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and
asynchronous execution of a modification, please refer to the related
section of the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration.md#executing-a-migration-plan).

400.description:
In case following parameters are missing: instructions,
processDefinitionId, activityId or transitionId, processInstanceIds
or processInstanceQuery, an exception of type
`InvalidRequestException` is returned. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

requestBody.description:
Please note that if both processInstances and processInstanceQuery are provided,
then the resulting execution will be performed on the union of these sets.
**Unallowed property**: `historicProcessInstanceQuery`

post.description: Create a batch to set retries of jobs associated with given processes asynchronously.

Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if neither processInstanceIds, nor processInstanceQuery is present.
Or if the retry count is not specified.

requestBody.description: A JSON object which corresponds to the type of the saved query of the filter, i.e., if the resource type of the filter is Task the body should form a valid task query corresponding to the Task resource.

example-1.description: POST `/filter/aTaskFilterId/list/?firstResult=0&maxResults=2`. **Note**: The examples show a task filter. So the request body corresponds to a task query. For other resource types the request body will differ.

post.description:
Executes the saved query of the filter by id and returns the result list. This
method is slightly more powerful then the 
[Get Execute FilterList](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/filter/get-execute-list/) method
because it allows to extend the saved query of the filter.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON array containing JSON objects corresponding to the matching entity interface in the engine. This depends on the saved query in the filter. Therefore it is not possible to specify a generic result format, i.e., if the resource type of the filter is Task the result will correspond to the Task interface in the engine.

example-1.description: POST `/filter/aTaskFilterId/list/?firstResult=0&maxResults=2`. **Note**: The examples show the result of a task filter. So the response corresponds to a task, but for other filters the response format will differ.

The extending query was invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:

get.description:
Retrieves a report about the duration of completed process instances, grouped by a period.
These reports include the maximum, minimum and average duration of all completed process instances which were started in a given period.

**Note:** This only includes historic data.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid or mandatory parameters are not supplied.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to read the history.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description:
**Mandatory.** Specifies the type of the report to retrieve.
To retrieve a report about the duration of process instances, the value must be set to `duration`.

parameters.name: periodUnit
parameters.description: **Mandatory.** Specifies the granularity of the report. Valid values are `month` and `quarter`.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date.
By [default](), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2016-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

get.description:
Retrieves runtime statistics of a given process definition, grouped by activities.
These statistics include the number of running activity instances, optionally the number of failed jobs
and also optionally the number of incidents either grouped by incident types or for a specific incident type.
**Note**: This does not include historic data.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition.

parameters.name: failedJobs
parameters.description: Whether to include the number of failed jobs in the result or not. Valid values are `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: incidents
parameters.description:
Valid values for this property are `true` or `false`.
If this property has been set to `true` the result will include the corresponding number of incidents
for each occurred incident type.
If it is set to `false`, the incidents will not be included in the result.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidentsForType`.

parameters.name: incidentsForType
parameters.description:
If this property has been set with any incident type (i.e., a string value) the result
will only include the number of incidents for the assigned incident type.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidents`.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

put.description:
Activates or suspends process instances by providing certain criteria:

# Activate/Suspend Process Instance By Process Definition Id
* `suspend`
* `processDefinitionId`

# Activate/Suspend Process Instance By Process Definition Key

* `suspend`
* `processDefinitionKey`
* `processDefinitionTenantId`
* `processDefinitionWithoutTenantId`

# Activate/Suspend Process Instance In Group
* `suspend`
* `processInstanceIds`
* `processInstanceQuery`
* `historicProcessInstanceQuery`

get.description:
Retrieves a variable from the context of a given execution by id. Does not traverse
the parent execution hierarchy.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution to retrieve the variable from.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to get.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically
variables that store custom Java objects) should be deserialized
on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on
server side and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java
classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.
If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its
serialized format. For example, a variable that is serialized as
XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of
backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to
`false` when developing web applications that are independent of
the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

delete.description:

get.description:
Queries for distinct topic names of external tasks that fulfill given parameters.
Query can be restricted to only tasks with retries left, tasks that are locked, or tasks
that are unlocked. The parameters withLockedTasks and withUnlockedTasks are
exclusive. Setting them both to true will return an empty list.
Providing no parameters will return a list of all distinct topic names with external tasks.

400.description: Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.

parameters.name: withLockedTasks
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withUnlockedTasks
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

post.description:
Sets the number of retries left to execute external tasks by id asynchronously. If retries are set to 0,
an incident is created.

400.description:
If neither externalTaskIds nor externalTaskQuery are present or externalTaskIds contains null value or 
the number of retries is negative or null, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task, 
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

requestBody.description: Provide the id of the user that the task should be delegated to.

post.description: Delegates a task to another user.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or delegation was not successful. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to delegate.

parameters.name: type

Filter by authorization type. (0=global, 1=grant, 2=revoke).

for more information about authorization types.

get.description:
Queries for decision definitions that fulfill given parameters.
Parameters may be the properties of decision definitions, such as the name, key or version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using
the [Get Decision Definition Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/decision-definition/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition id.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition key, i.e., the id in the DMN 1.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those decision definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: withoutDecisionRequirementsDefinition
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which does not belongs to any decision requirements definition.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeDecisionDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tags of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.description: Filter by job id.

parameters.name: jobIds
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of job ids.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given job definition.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given process instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceIds
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given comma-separated list of process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for the given execution.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the jobs run on.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: executable
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which are executable, i.e., retries > 0 and due date is `null` or due
date is in the past. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: timers
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are timers. Cannot be used together with `messages`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are messages. Cannot be used together with `timers`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: dueDates
parameters.description:
Only select jobs where the due date is lower or higher than the given date.
Due date expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: createTimes
parameters.description:
Only select jobs created before or after the given date.

Create time expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: withException
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that failed due to an exception. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is
the default behavior.

parameters.name: exceptionMessage
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception with the given message.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception at an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have no retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Only include jobs which belong to one of the passed comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include jobs which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: includeJobsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include jobs which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

get.description:
Retrieves a historic decision instance by id, according to the 
`HistoricDecisionInstance` interface in the engine.

404.description:
Historic decision instance with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic decision instance to be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeInputs
parameters.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeOutputs
parameters.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableBinaryFetching
parameters.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableCustomObjectDeserialization
parameters.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables visible from the task. Updates precede deletions. So, if a variable is
updated AND deleted, the deletion overrides the update. A variable is visible from the task if it is a
local task variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid. For example the value could not be parsed to an `Integer` value
or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Update or delete could not be executed because the task is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to set variables for.

get.description:
Retrieves all variables visible from the task. A variable is visible from the task if it is a local task
variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

500.description:
Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on the server side (default `true`).
If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

requestBody.description: Provide the id of the user that claims the task.

post.description:
Claims a task for a specific user.

**Note:** The difference with the
[Set Assignee](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/task/post-assignee/)
method is that here a check is performed to see if the task already has a user
assigned to it.

500.description:
Task with given id does not exist or claiming was not successful. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to claim.

get.description: Retrieves a group by id.

404.description:
Group with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group to be retrieved.

options.description:
The `/group` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, one for the resource as such and this one for individual group instances.
The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that the currently authenticated user can perform on the
`/group/{id}` resource instance. If the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations
to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group.

delete.description: Deletes a group by id.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

403.description: Identity service is read-only (Cannot modify users / groups / memberships).

404.description:
Group cannot be found. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group to be deleted.

put.description: Updates a given group by id.

500.description:
The group could not be updated due to an internal server error.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error
response format.

403.description: Identity service is read-only (Cannot modify users / groups / memberships).

404.description: If the group with the requested Id cannot be found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the group.

options.description:
The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that the
currently authenticated user can perform on the resource. If the user
can perform an operation or not may depend on various things,
including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant

post.description:
Queries for the number of external tasks that fulfill given parameters. This method takes the same message
body as the [Get External Tasks (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/external-task/post-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of external tasks that fulfill given parameters. Takes the same parameters as the
[Get External Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/external-task/get-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: externalTaskId
parameters.description: Filter by an external task's id.

parameters.name: externalTaskIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

parameters.name: topicName
parameters.description: Filter by an external task topic.

parameters.name: workerId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: notLocked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

parameters.name: lockExpirationAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: lockExpirationBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the activity that an external task is created for.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of ids of the activities that an external task is created for.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the execution that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process instance that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of process instance ids that an external task may belong to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process definition that an external task belongs to.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
An external task must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value.
Value must be a valid `long` value.

404.description:
Job with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job to get the exception stacktrace for.

get.description: Retrieves a deployment resource by resource id for the given deployment.

404.description:
Deployment Resource with given resource id or deployment id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The id of the deployment resource

get.description:
Requests the number of decision definitions that fulfill the query criteria.
Takes the same filtering parameters as the
[Get Decision Definition](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/decision-definition/get-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition id.

parameters.name: decisionDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition ids.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition names that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment the id belongs to.

parameters.name: deployedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed after (exclusive) a specific time.

parameters.name: deployedAt
parameters.description:
Filter by the deploy time of the deployment the decision definition belongs to.
Only selects decision definitions that have been deployed at a specific time (exact match).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition key, i.e., the id in the DMN 1.0 XML. Exact match.

parameters.name: keyLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition category. Exact match.

parameters.name: categoryLike
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition categories that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter by decision definition version.

parameters.name: latestVersion
parameters.description:
Only include those decision definitions that are latest versions.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the decision definition resource. Exact match.

parameters.name: resourceNameLike
parameters.description: Filter by names of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition this decision definition belongs to.

parameters.name: withoutDecisionRequirementsDefinition
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which does not belongs to any decision requirements definition.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeDecisionDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include decision definitions which belong to no tenant.
Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: versionTag
parameters.description: Filter by the version tag.

parameters.name: versionTagLike
parameters.description: Filter by the version tags of those decision definition resources that the parameter is a substring of.

get.description:
Retrieves  the rendered form for the latest version of the process definition which belongs to no tenant.
This method can be used to get the HTML rendering of a
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms).

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.description:
A `/process-definition/key/anKey/rendered-form` HTML
                                       GET response body providing the rendered (generated) form content.

400.description:
Process definition has no form field metadata defined. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.  See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

put.description: Activates or suspends process definitions with the given process definition key.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if the provided `executionDate` parameter doesn't have the expected format or
if the `processDefinitionKey` parameter is `null`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a process definition according to the `ProcessDefinition` interface in the engine.

400.description:
Process definition with given `id` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to be retrieved.

delete.description: Deletes a running process instance by id.

404.description:
Not found
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process definition to be deleted.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description:
`true`, if all process instances, historic process instances and jobs
for this process definition should be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: `true`, if only the built-in ExecutionListeners should be notified with the end event.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description:
A boolean value to control whether input/output mappings should be executed during deletion.
`true`, if input/output mappings should not be invoked.

post.description:
Queries for the number of executions that fulfill given parameters. This method
takes the same message body as the [Get Executions
POST](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/post-query/) method and
therefore it is slightly more powerful than the [Get Execution
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of executions that fulfill given parameters.
Takes the same parameters as the [Get
Executions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/get-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: businessKey
parameters.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

parameters.name: signalEventSubscriptionName
parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

parameters.name: messageEventSubscriptionName
parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that have variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: processVariables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables with certain
values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

requestBody.description: A JSON object which corresponds to the type of the saved query of the filter, i.e., if the resource type of the filter is Task the body should form a valid task query corresponding to the Task resource.

example-1.description: POST `filter/aTaskFilterId/singleResult`. Note: The examples show a task filter. So the request body corresponds to a task query. For other resource types the request body will differ.

post.description:
Executes the saved query of the filter by id and returns the count. This method is
slightly more powerful then the [Get Execute Filter Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/filter/get-execute-count/) 
method because it allows to extend the saved query of the filter.

400.description:
The extending query was invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
The authenticated user is unauthorized to read this filter. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Filter with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to execute.

get.description: Executes the saved query of the filter by id and returns the count.

403.description:
The authenticated user is unauthorized to read this filter. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Filter with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to execute.

get.description:
Retrieves the form variables for a task. The form variables take form data specified
on the task into account. If form fields are defined, the variable types and default
values of the form fields are taken into account.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
id is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables for.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

post.description:
Completes a task and updates process variables using a form submit. There are two
difference between this method and the `complete` method:

* If the task is in state `PENDING` - i.e., has been delegated before, it is not
completed but resolved. Otherwise it will be completed.
* If the task has Form Field Metadata defined, the process engine will perform backend
validation for any form fields which have validators defined.
See the
[Generated Task Forms](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/_index/#generated-task-forms)
section of the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/) for more information.

200.description: Request successful. The response contains the process variables.

example-1.description: Response of a submitted task form with variables in return

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value
or the passed variable type is not supported.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be resumed successfully.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for
the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. The response contains no variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to submit the form for.

options.description:
The `/user` resource supports two custom `OPTIONS` requests, one for the resource as such
and one for individual user instances. The `OPTIONS` request allows checking for the set of
available operations that the currently authenticated user can perform on the /user resource.
If the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various things, including the user's
authorizations to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process
engine. `OPTIONS /user` returns available interactions on the resource.

options.description:
The `/tenant` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, one for the resource as such and this one for
individual tenant instances. The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that
the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/tenant/{id}` resource. If the user can perform an
operation or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations to interact with this
resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.
