post.description:
Queries for external tasks that fulfill given parameters in the form of a JSON object.

This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get External Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/external-task/get-query/) method because it allows to
specify a hierarchical result sorting.

200.description: Request successful. The Response is a JSON array of external task objects.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description:
Queries for the external tasks that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be static as well as dynamic
runtime properties of executions. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get External Task Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/external-task/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: externalTaskId
parameters.description: Filter by an external task's id.

parameters.name: externalTaskIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by the comma-separated list of external task ids.

parameters.name: topicName
parameters.description: Filter by an external task topic.

parameters.name: workerId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the worker that the task was most recently locked by.

parameters.name: locked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently locked (i.e., they have a lock time and it has not expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: notLocked
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that are currently not locked (i.e., they have no lock or it has expired).
Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have a positive (> 0) number of retries (or `null`). Value may only be
`true`, as `false` matches any external task.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only include external tasks that have 0 retries. Value may only be `true`, as `false` matches any
external task.

parameters.name: lockExpirationAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires after a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: lockExpirationBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to external tasks that have a lock that expires before a given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:

parameters.name: suspended

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals

parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

post.description:
Starts the latest version of the process definition which belongs to no tenant
using a set of process variables and the business key.
If the start event has Form Field Metadata defined, the process engine will perform backend validation
for any form fields which have validators defined.
See [Documentation on Generated Task Forms](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms).

400.description:
The instance could not be created due to an invalid variable value,
for example if the value could not be parsed to an `Integer` value or
the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
The instance could not be created successfully.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.description: The key of the process definition to submit the form for.

post.description:
Queries for the number of historic process instances that fulfill the given parameters.
This method takes the same message body as the [Get Process Instances (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/process-instance/get-process-instance-query/) method and
therefore it is slightly more powerful than the [Get Process Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/process-instance/post-process-instance-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of historic process instances that fulfill the given parameters.
Takes the same parameters as the [Get Process Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/process-instance/get-process-instance-query/) method.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.description: Restrict the query to all process instances that are top level process instances.

parameters.description:
Only include finished process instances. This flag includes all process instances
that are completed or terminated. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were started after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were finished after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: executedActivityAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an activity after the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: executedActivityBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an activity before the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: executedJobAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an job after the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: executedJobBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that executed an job before the given date (inclusive).
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedBy
parameters.description: Only include process instances that were started by the given user.

parameters.description: Restrict query to all process instances that are sub process instances of the given case instance. Takes a case instance id.

parameters.description: Restrict query to one process instance that has a sub case instance with the given id.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a list of tenant ids. A process instance must have one of the given tenant ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: Only include historic process instances which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: executedActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that executed an activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.name: activeActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that have an active activity with one of given ids. Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`

parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are active.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are suspended.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are completed.

parameters.name: externallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are externallyTerminated.

parameters.name: internallyTerminated
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that are internallyTerminated.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include process instances that have/had variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:
A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`. `key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as String objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` - greater than; `gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or equal to; `like`.

Key and value may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable names provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableName and variablename are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description: Match all variable values provided in variables case-insensitively. If set to `true` variableValue and variablevalue are treated as equal.

parameters.description:

When the value is set to `true`, only suspended batches will be returned and

the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: withFailures
parameters.description:
Only include batches having jobs with failures.
Value can only be `true`.

parameters.name: withoutFailures
parameters.description:

If the process definition's deployment contains an image resource with the same file name
as the process definition, the deployed image will be returned by the Get Diagram endpoint.
Example: `someProcess.bpmn` and `someProcess.png`.
Supported file extentions for the image are: `svg`, `png`, `jpg`, and `gif`.

Files with MIME type information image/png, image/gif, ...

post.description:
Executes a migration plan asynchronously (batch) for multiple process instances.
To execute a migration plan synchronously, use the
[Execute MigrationPlan](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/migration/execute-migration/)
method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous
execution of a migration plan, please refer to the related section of
[the user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration/#executing-a-migration-plan).

400.description:
The request is not valid if one or more of the following statements apply:

* The provided migration plan is not valid, so an exception of type
`MigrationPlanValidationException` is returned.
* In case additional parameters of the request are unexpected, an
exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic process instances asynchronously (batch).

At least `historicProcessInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery` has to be provided.
If both are provided, all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Bad Request
Request was unsuccessfull due to a bad user request. This occurs if some of the query parameters are invalid,
e. g. if neither `historicProcessInstances` nor `historicProcessInstanceQuery` is present or if no mode is specified.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.

Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.

get.description:
Queries for user operation log entries that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get User Operation Log Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/user-operation-log/get-user-operation-log-query-count/)
method.

Note that the properties of operation log entries are interpreted as
restrictions on the entities they apply to. That means, if a single
process instance is updated, the field `processInstanceId` is
populated. If a single operation updates all process instances of the
same process definition, the field `processInstanceId` is `null` (a
`null` restriction is viewed as a wildcard, i.e., matches a process
instance with any id) and the field `processDefinitionId` is
populated. This way, which entities were changed by a user operation
can easily be reconstructed.

example-1.summary: Gets an operation that updates a single task.

example-2.summary: Gets an operation that updates a multiple process instances with the same key.

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

post.description:
Executes a modification synchronously for multiple process instances.
To modify a single process instance, use the
[Modify Process Instance Execution State](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-instance/post-modification/) method.
To execute a modification asynchronously, use the
[Execute Modification Async (Batch)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/modification/post-modification-async/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and
asynchronous execution of a modification, please refer to the related
section of the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration.md#executing-a-migration-plan).

for the error response format.

post.description:
Queries for tasks that fulfill a given filter. This method is slightly more powerful
than the [Get Tasks](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/task/get-query/) method because it
allows filtering by multiple process or task variables of types `String`, `Number`
or `Boolean`. The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Task Count (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/task/post-query-count/) method.

**Security Consideration**:
There are several parameters (such as `assigneeExpression`) for specifying an EL
expression. These are disabled by default to prevent remote code execution. See the
section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/)
in the user guide for details.

comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: includeAssignedTasks

Also include tasks that are assigned to users in candidate queries. Default is to only

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the given user is involved in. A user is involved in a task if 
an identity link exists between task and user (e.g., the user is the assignee).

parameters.name: involvedUserExpression
parameters.description:
Only include tasks that the user described by the given expression is involved in.
A user is involved in a task if an identity link exists between task and user
(e.g., the user is the assignee). See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions.

[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a

for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.description:

[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g.,
`2013-01-23T14:42:45.234+0200`.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the date described by the given
expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistent
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.432+0200`. The
typical use case is to query all `active` tasks for a user for a given date.

parameters.name: followUpBeforeOrNotExistentExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have no followUp date or a followUp date before the date
described by the given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)

format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.342+0200`.

parameters.name: createdAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created after the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the given date. By
[default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the
format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: createdBeforeExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were created before the date described by the given expression.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the given date. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must
have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.332+0200`.

parameters.name: updatedAfterExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were updated after the date described by the given expression. Every action that fires 
a [task update event](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/delegation-code/#task-listener-event-lifecycle) is considered as updating the task.
See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to a
`java.util.Date` or `org.joda.time.DateTime` object.

parameters.name: delegationState
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are in the given delegation state. Valid values are
`PENDING` and `RESOLVED`.

parameters.name: candidateGroups
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the given candidate groups. Takes a
comma-separated list of group names, so for example `developers,support,sales`.

parameters.name: candidateGroupsExpression
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are offered to any of the candidate groups described by the
given expression. See the
[user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/expression-language/#internal-context-functions)
for more information on available functions. The expression must evaluate to
`java.util.List` of Strings.

parameters.name: withCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate user. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateUsers
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate users. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false`
is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended tasks. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: taskVariables
processVariables
caseInstanceVariables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableName` and `variablename` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values in this query case-insensitively. If set
`variableValue` and `variablevalue` are treated as equal.

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: Restrict query to all tasks that are sub tasks of the given task. Takes a task id.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

post.description:
Queries for job definitions that fulfill given parameters. This method is slightly
more powerful than the
[Get Job Definitions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/job-definition/get-query/)
method because it allows filtering by multiple job definitions of
types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description:
Queries for job definitions that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Job Definition Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/job-definition/get-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by job definition id.

parameters.name: activityIdIn
parameters.description: Only include job definitions which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated activity ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only include job definitions which exist for the given process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Only include job definitions which exist for the given process definition key.

parameters.name: jobType
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which exist for the given job type. See the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#job-creation)
for more information about job types.

parameters.name: jobConfiguration
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which exist for the given job configuration. For example: for
timer jobs it is the timer configuration.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Only include active job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
Only include suspended job definitions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: withOverridingJobPriority
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions that have an overriding job priority defined. The only
effective value is `true`. If set to `false`, this filter is not applied.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated tenant
ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include job definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeJobDefinitionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include job definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with
`tenantIdIn`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description: Retrieves a list of metrics, aggregated for a given interval.

400.description: Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the metric.

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description:
The name of the reporter (host), on which the metrics was logged. This will have
value provided by the [hostname configuration property](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/deployment-descriptors/tags/process-engine/#hostname).

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date (inclusive).

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date (exclusive).

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
The interval for which the metrics should be aggregated. Time unit is seconds.
Default: The interval is set to 15 minutes (900 seconds).

parameters.name: aggregateByReporter
parameters.description: Aggregate metrics by reporter.

get.description: Retrieves a variable by id.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

parameters.name: deserializeValue
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:**  While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

get.description: Retrieves the binary content of a deployment resource for the given deployment by id.

200.description: Request successful. The media type of the response depends on the filename.

schema.description: For files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

Files with MIME type information are returned as the saved type. For example, a
                            `process.bpmn` resource will have the media type `application/xml`.

400.description:
Deployment Resource with given resource id or deployment id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The id of the deployment resource.

post.description:
Fetches and locks a specific number of external tasks for execution by a worker. Query can be restricted
to specific task topics and for each task topic an individual lock time can be provided.

400.description:
Bad Request. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves a single filter by id, according to the `Filter` interface in the engine.

403.description:
The authenticated user is unauthorized to read this filter.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Filter with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to be retrieved.

parameters.name: itemCount
parameters.description:
If set to `true`, each filter result will contain an `itemCount`
property with the number of items matched by the filter itself.

options.description:
The OPTIONS request allows you to check for the set of available operations 
that the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/filter` resource.
Whether the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various
factors, including the users authorizations to interact with this
resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to be checked.

delete.description: Deletes a filter by id.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

403.description:
The authenticated user is unauthorized to delete this filter.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Filter cannot be found. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to be deleted.

put.description: Updates an existing filter.

400.description:
Filter was invalid. See
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

403.description:
The authenticated user is unauthorized to update this filter.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Filter cannot be found. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the filter to be updated.

post.description:
Reports a business error in the context of a running external task by id. The error code must be specified
to identify the BPMN error handler.

400.description:
Returned if the task's most recent lock was not acquired by the provided worker.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Returned if the corresponding process instance could not be resumed successfully.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task,
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the external task in which context a BPMN error is reported.

get.summary: Get XML By Key and Tenant
get.description: Retrieves the XML of the latest version of the decision definition for tenant

value.dmnXml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                                    <definitions xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20151101/dmn.xsd"
                                                 id="definitions"
                                                 name="camunda"
                                                 namespace="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/dmn">
                                      <decision id="testDecision" name="decision">
                                        <decisionTable id="table">
                                          <output id="result" name="result" >
                                          </output>
                                          <rule id="rule">
                                            <outputEntry id="output1">
                                              <text>"not okay"</text>
                                            </outputEntry>
                                          </rule>
                                        </decisionTable>
                                      </decision>
                                    </definitions>

404.description:
Decision definition with given key does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the decision definition (the latest version thereof).

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the decision definition belongs to.

get.description: Retrieves a job by id, according to the `Job` interface in the engine.

404.description:
Job with given id does not exist. See the

for the error response format.

parameters.name: id

500.description:
The job could not be deleted. See the

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

404.description:
Job with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job to be deleted.

post.description: Deletes multiple process instances asynchronously (batch).

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, i.e., neither processInstanceIds, nor processInstanceQuery is present

get.description:
Retrieves latest version the BPMN 2.0 XML of a process definition.
Returns the XML for the latest version of the process definition for tenant.

value.bpmn20Xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<definitions
                         xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL"
                         xmlns:camunda="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/bpmn"
                         targetNamespace="Examples">
                         <process id="oneTaskProcess" isExecutable="true">
                           <startEvent id="theStart" />
                           <sequenceFlow id="flow1" sourceRef="theStart" targetRef="theEnd" />
                           <endEvent id="theEnd" />
                         </process>
                       </definitions>

403.description:
The Process Definition xml cannot be retrieved due to missing permissions on the Process Definition resource.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)

404.description:
Process definition with given id does not exist. See the

parameters.name: tenant-id

get.description:
Queries for event subscriptions that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Event Subscriptions count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/event-subscription/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Bad Request
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid,
for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: eventSubscriptionId
parameters.description: Only select subscription with the given id.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions for events with the given name.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description:
Only select subscriptions for events with the given type.
Valid values: `message`, `signal`, `compensate` and `conditional`.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Only select subscriptions that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids.
Only select subscriptions that belong to one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only select subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeEventSubscriptionsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Select event subscriptions which have no tenant id.
Can be used in combination with tenantIdIn parameter.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

get.description:
Retrieves a report of completed tasks. When the report type is set to `count`, the
report contains a list of completed task counts where an entry contains the task name, the
definition key of the task, the process definition id, the process definition key, the process
definition name and the count of how many tasks were completed for the specified key in a given
period. When the report type is set to `duration`, the report contains a minimum, maximum and
average duration value of all completed task instances in a given period.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `completedAfter`
parameter is supplied, but the date format is wrong. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description:
**Mandatory.** Specifies the kind of the report to execute. To retrieve a report
about the duration of process instances the value must be set to `duration`. For a
report of the completed tasks in a specific timespan the value must be set to `count`.

parameters.name: periodUnit
parameters.description:
When the report type is set to `duration`, this parameter is **mandatory**.
Specifies the granularity of the report. Valid values are `month` and `quarter`.

parameters.name: completedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were completed before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: completedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were completed after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description:
When the report type is set to `count`, this parameter is **mandatory**. Groups the
tasks report by a given criterion. Valid values are `taskName` and `processDefinition`.

delete.description: Clears the annotation of an incident with given id.

400.description: Returned if no incident can be found for the given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to clear the annotation at.

put.description: Sets the annotation of an incident with given id.

400.description: Returned if no incident can be found for the given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the incident to clear the annotation at.

get.description:
Retrieves a message event subscription for a given execution by id and a message
name.

404.description:
A message subscription for the given name and execution does not exist.
This may either mean that the execution does not exist, or that
it is not subscribed on such a message.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the execution that holds the subscription.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message that the subscription corresponds to.

get.description: Retrieves a process instance by id, according to the `ProcessInstance` interface in the engine.

404.description:
Process instance with given id does not exist. See the 
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to be retrieved.

delete.description: Deletes a running process instance by id.

404.description:
Not found
Process instance with given id does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: If set to true, the custom listeners will be skipped.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description: If set to true, the input/output mappings will be skipped.

parameters.name: skipSubprocesses
parameters.description: If set to true, subprocesses related to deleted processes will be skipped.

parameters.name: failIfNotExists
parameters.description: If set to false, the request will still be successful if the process id is not found.

post.description:
Sets the removal time to multiple historic decision instances asynchronously
(batch).

At least `historicDecisionInstanceIds` or
`historicDecisionInstanceQuery` has to be provided. If both are
provided, all instances matching query criterion and instances from the list
will be updated with a removal time.

400.description:
Request was unsuccessfull due to a bad user request. This occurs if
some of the query parameters are invalid, e. g. if neither
historicDecisionInstances nor historicDecisionInstanceQuery is
present or if no mode is specified.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description: Retrieves an Activity Instance (Tree) for a given process instance by id.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: id

post.description:
Reports a failure to execute an external task by id. A number of retries and a timeout until the task can
be retried can be specified. If retries are set to 0, an incident for this task is created.

400.description:
Returned if the task's most recent lock was not acquired by the provided worker. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Returned if the corresponding process instance could not be resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task,
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the external task to report a failure for.

Process variables and business key may be supplied in the request body.

get.description:
Requests the number of batches that fulfill the query criteria.
Takes the same filtering parameters as the [Get Batches](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/batch/get-query/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: Filter by batch id.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Filter by batch type.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/batch/#creating-a-batch)
for more information about batch types.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of `Strings`. A batch matches if it has one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include batches which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether only active or suspended batches should be included.
When the value is set to `true`, only suspended batches will be returned and
when the value is set to `false`, only active batches will be returned.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Only include batches that were started by this user id.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Only include batches that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Only include batches that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: withFailures
parameters.description:
Only include batches having jobs with failures.
Value can only be `true`.

parameters.name: withoutFailures
parameters.description:
Only include batches having jobs without failures.
Value can only be `true`.

get.description: Retrieves latest version the BPMN 2.0 XML of a process definition.

value.bpmn20Xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<definitions
                         xmlns="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL"
                         xmlns:camunda="http://camunda.org/schema/1.0/bpmn"
                         targetNamespace="Examples">
                         <process id="oneTaskProcess" isExecutable="true">
                           <startEvent id="theStart" />
                           <sequenceFlow id="flow1" sourceRef="theStart" targetRef="theEnd" />
                           <endEvent id="theEnd" />
                         </process>
                       </definitions>

403.description:
The Process Definition xml cannot be retrieved due to missing permissions on the Process Definition resource.

for the error response format.

Process definition with given id does not exist. See the

get.description: Retrieves a historic variable by id.

404.description:
Variable with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the variable instance.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

get.description:
Queries for the number of report results about a decision definition and finished
decision instances relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).
Takes the same parameters as the [Get Cleanable Decision Instance Report](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/decision-definition/get-cleanable-decision-instance-report/)

parameters.description: Filter by decision definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of decision definition keys.

parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A decision definition must have one of the given tenant 
ids.

parameters.description:
Only include decision definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false`

parameters.description:

as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.description:
Include job definitions which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with
`tenantIdIn`. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables of a process instance by id. Updates precede deletions.
So, if a variable is updated AND deleted, the deletion overrides the update.

400.description:
Bad Request
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or
the passed variable type is not supported.

500.description: Update or delete could not be executed, for example because the process instance does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to set variables for.

get.description: Retrieves all variables of a given process instance by id.

500.description: Process instance with given id does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

Note: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to false
when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

method and therefore it is more powerful regarding variable values
than the
[Get Variable Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/variable-instance/get-variable-instance-query-count/)
method.

for the error response format.

parameters.name: variableName

parameters.description: Restrict to variables with a name like the parameter.

parameters.description: Filter by variable value. Is treated as a `String` object on server side.

parameters.description:
Match the variable name provided in `variableName` and `variableNameLike` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are

parameters.description:
Match the variable value provided in `variableValue` case-insensitively. If set to `true`

parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-

**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be

post.description:
Re-deploys an existing deployment.

The deployment resources to re-deploy can be restricted by using the properties `resourceIds` or
`resourceNames`. If no deployment resources to re-deploy are passed then all existing resources of the
given deployment are re-deployed.

**Warning**: Deployments can contain custom code in form of scripts or EL expressions to customize
process behavior. This may be abused for remote execution of arbitrary code. See the section on
[security considerations for custom code](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/securing-custom-code/) in
the user guide for details.

404.description:
Deployment or a deployment resource for the given deployment does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the deployment to re-deploy.

put.summary: Set Job Definition Priority by Id
put.description:
Sets an overriding execution priority for jobs with the given definition id.
Optionally, the priorities of all the definitions' existing jobs are
updated accordingly. The priority can be reset by setting it to
`null`, meaning that a new job's priority will not be determined based
on its definition's priority any longer. See the
[user guide on job prioritization](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/the-job-executor/#set-job-definition-priorities-via-managementservice-api)
for details.

The retries could not be set successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Job definition with given id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to be updated.

post.description:
Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters through a JSON object.
This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get Variable Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/variable-
instance/get-query/) method because it allows filtering by multiple
variable instances of types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

get.description:
Query for variable instances that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the
properties of variable instances, such as the name or type. The size
of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get Variable Instance
Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/variable-instance/get-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable instance name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the variable instance name. The parameter can include the wildcard `%` to
express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or
contains (`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
process instance ids.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case instance ids.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated task
ids.

parameters.name: batchIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
batch ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variableValues
parameters.description:
Only include variable instances that have the certain values.
Value filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.

**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableName** and **variablename** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variableValues` case-insensitively. If set to
`true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableScopeIdIn
parameters.description: Only include variable instances which belong to one of passed scope ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

powerful than the [Get Jobs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/job/get-query/)

`Number` or `Boolean`.

Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/job/get-query-count/) method.

parameters.description: Only select jobs which exist for an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: withRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: executable
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which are executable, i.e., retries > 0 and due date is `null` or due
date is in the past. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: timers
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are timers. Cannot be used together with `messages`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that are messages. Cannot be used together with `timers`. Value may only
be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: dueDates
parameters.description:
Only select jobs where the due date is lower or higher than the given date.
Due date expressions are comma-separated and are structured as follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: createTimes
parameters.description:
Only select jobs created before or after the given date.

Create time expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid condition value has the form `operator_value`.
`operator` is the comparison operator to be used and `value` the date value
as string.

Valid operator values are: `gt` - greater than; `lt` - lower than.
`value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: withException
parameters.description:
Only select jobs that failed due to an exception. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is
the default behavior.

parameters.name: exceptionMessage
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception with the given message.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description: Only select jobs that failed due to an exception at an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: noRetriesLeft
parameters.description:
Only select jobs which have no retries left. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only include active jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description: Only include suspended jobs. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: priorityLowerThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority lower than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: priorityHigherThanOrEquals
parameters.description:
Only include jobs with a priority higher than or equal to the given value. Value must be a
valid `long` value.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Only include jobs which belong to one of the passed comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include jobs which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: includeJobsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include jobs which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

post.description:
Executes a migration plan synchronously for multiple process instances. To execute
a migration plan asynchronously, use the
[Execute Migration Plan Async(Batch)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/migration/execute-migration-async/)
method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous
execution of a migration plan, please refer to the related section of
[the user guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-migration/#executing-a-migration-plan).

400.description:
The request is not valid if one or more of the following statements apply:

* The provided migration plan is not valid, so an exception of type
`MigrationPlanValidationException` is returned.
* The provided migration plan is not valid for a specific process
instance it is applied to, so an exception of type
`MigratingProcessInstanceValidationException` is returned.
* In case additional parameters of the request are unexpected, an
exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned.

See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables in the context of an execution by id. The updates
do not propagate upwards in the execution hierarchy.
Updates precede deletions. So, if a variable is updated AND deleted,
the deletion overrides the update.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

500.description:
Update or delete could not be executed, for example because the execution does not
exist.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of

get.description:
Retrieves the latest version of the process definition for tenant according to
the `ProcessDefinition` interface in the engine.

400.description:
Process definition with given `key` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

delete.description: Deletes process definitions by a given key and which belong to a tenant id.

403.description:
Forbidden
The process definitions with the given `key` cannot be deleted due to missing permissions.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Not found
Process definition with given key does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definitions to be deleted.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definitions belong to.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description:
`true`, if all process instances, historic process instances and jobs
for this process definition should be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: `true`, if only the built-in ExecutionListeners should be notified with the end event.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description:
A boolean value to control whether input/output mappings should be executed during deletion.
`true`, if input/output mappings should not be invoked.

post.description:
Starts the latest version of the process definition for a tenant
using a set of process variables and the business key.
If the start event has Form Field Metadata defined, the process engine will perform backend validation
for any form fields which have validators defined.
See [Documentation on Generated Task Forms](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms).

400.description:
The instance could not be created due to an invalid variable value,
for example if the value could not be parsed to an `Integer` value or
the passed variable type is not supported.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
The instance could not be created successfully.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.description: The key of the process definition to submit the form for.

parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

post.description:
Submits a list of modification instructions to change a process instance's execution state.
A modification instruction is one of the following:

* Starting execution before an activity
* Starting execution after an activity on its single outgoing sequence flow
* Starting execution on a specific sequence flow
* Canceling an activity instance, transition instance, or all instances (activity or transition) for an activity

Instructions are executed immediately and in the order they are provided in this request's body.
Variables can be provided with every starting instruction.

The exact semantics of modification can be read about in the [User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-modification/).

400.description: At least one modification instruction misses required parameters.

500.description: The modification cannot be performed, for example because it starts a failing activity.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to modify.
