dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: evaluatedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that were evaluated after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-
dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Restrict to instances that were evaluated by the given user.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstanceId
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances that have a given root decision instance id.
This also includes the decision instance with the given id.

parameters.name: rootDecisionInstancesOnly
parameters.description:
Restrict to instances those are the root decision instance of an evaluation.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: decisionRequirementsDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by the key of the decision requirements definition the instances belongs to.

parameters.name: includeInputs
parameters.description:
Include input values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: includeOutputs
parameters.description:
Include output values in the result.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableBinaryFetching
parameters.description:
Disables fetching of byte array input and output values.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: disableCustomObjectDeserialization
parameters.description:
Disables deserialization of input and output values that are custom objects.
Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

requestBody.description: For binary variables a multipart form submit with the following parts:

example-3.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="myFile.txt"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        File
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-1.description: Post binary content of a byte array variable.
example-1.value:
```
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="image.png"
                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

```

                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ```

post.description: Sets the serialized value for a binary variable or the binary value for a file variable.

400.description:
Bad Request
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if no filename is set.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

get.description:
Retrieves the content of a Process Variable by the Process Instance id and the Process Variable name.
Applicable for byte array or file Process Variables.

200.description:
Request successful.
        For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.
        File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

schema.description: For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.value: Content-Type: application/octet-stream

schema.description:
File variables with MIME type information are returned as the saved type.
            Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

example-1.value: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="someFile.txt"

400.description:
Bad Request
A Process Variable with the given id exists but does not serialize as binary data.

404.description:
Not Found
A Process Variable with the given id does not exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to retrieve the variable for.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

get.description:
Retrieves  the rendered form for the latest version of the process definition for a tenant.
This method can be used to get the HTML rendering of a
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms).

schema.description: For `application/xhtml+xml` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

example-1.description:
A `/process-definition/key/anKey/tenand-id/aTenantId/rendered-form` HTML
                                       GET response body providing the rendered (generated) form content.

400.description:
Process definition has no form field metadata defined. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Process definition with given key does not exist.  See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

post.summary: Modify Process Instance Execution State Async
post.description:
Submits a list of modification instructions to change a process instance's execution state async.
A modification instruction is one of the following:

* Starting execution before an activity
* Starting execution after an activity on its single outgoing sequence flow
* Starting execution on a specific sequence flow
* Cancelling an activity instance, transition instance, or all instances (activity or transition) for an activity

Instructions are executed asynchronous and in the order they are provided in this request's body.
Variables can be provided with every starting instruction.

The exact semantics of modification can be read about in the
[User guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-modification/).

400.description:
Bad Request
At least one modification instruction misses required parameters.

500.description: The modification cannot be performed, for example because it starts a failing activity.

403.description:
Forbidden
If the user is not allowed to execute batches. See the Introduction for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process instance to modify.

post.description:
Reports a business error in the context of a running task by id. The error code must
be specified to identify the BPMN error handler. See the documentation for
[Reporting Bpmn Error](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/bpmn20/tasks/user-task/#reporting-bpmn-error)
in User Tasks.

400.description:
Returned if the `errorCode` or `id` are not present in the request. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

403.description:
If the authenticated user is unauthorized to update the task. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task a BPMN error is reported for.

get.description:
Retrieves a report about a process definition and finished process instances
relevant to history cleanup (see
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)) 
so that you can tune the history time to live.
These reports include the count of the finished historic process
instances, cleanable process instances and basic process definition
data - id, key, name and version.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Cleanable Process Instance Report Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/process-definition/get-cleanable-process-instance-report-count/)
method.

500.description:
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: processDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition ids. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Filter by process definition keys. Must be a comma-separated list of process definition keys.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A process definition must have one of the given 
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include process definitions which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as
`false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: compact
parameters.description:
Only include process instances which have more than zero finished instances. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

post.description:
Resolves a task and updates execution variables.

Resolving a task marks that the assignee is done with the task delegated to them, and
that it can be sent back to the owner. Can only be executed when the task has been
delegated. The assignee will be set to the owner, who performed the delegation.

The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be
resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to resolve.

parameters.description:
Filter completed or not completed batches. If the value is
`true`, only completed batches, i.e., end time is set, are
returned. Otherwise, if the value is `false`, only running
batches, i.e., end time is null, are returned.

post.description:
Updates or deletes the variables in the context of a task. Updates precede deletions. So, if a variable is
updated AND deleted, the deletion overrides the update.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid. For example the value could not be parsed to an `Integer` value
or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
Update or delete could not be executed because the task is `null` or does not exist.. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to set variables for.

get.description: Retrieves all variables of a given task by id.

500.description:
Task id is `null` or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to retrieve the variables from.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store custom Java objects)
should be deserialized on the server side (default `true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and transformed to JSON
using [Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property introspection feature.
Note that this requires the Java classes of the variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we recommend setting this
parameter to `false` when developing web applications that are independent of the Java process
applications deployed to the engine.

get.description:
Retrieves the start form variables for the latest process definition for a tenant
(only if they are defined via the 
[Generated Task Form](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/task-forms/#generated-task-forms) approach).
The start form variables take form data specified on the start event into account.
If form fields are defined, the variable types and default values
of the form fields are taken into account.

200.description: Request successful. A JSON object containing a property for each variable returned.

404.description:
The key is null or does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant the process definition belongs to.

parameters.name: variableNames
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of variable names. Allows restricting the list of requested
variables to the variable names in the list. It is best practice to restrict the
list of variables to the variables actually required by the form in order to
minimize fetching of data. If the query parameter is ommitted all variables are
fetched. If the query parameter contains non-existent variable names, the variable
names are ignored.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that store
custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default true).

If set to true, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side and
transformed to JSON using [Jackson's](http://jackson.codehaus.org/) POJO/bean
property introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to false, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized format.
For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as a JSON string
containing XML.

**Note**: While true is the default value for reasons of backward compatibility, we
recommend setting this parameter to false when developing web applications that are
independent of the Java process applications deployed to the engine.

get.summary: Get Decision Requirements Diagram by Key and Tenant ID
get.description:
Retrieves the diagram of a decision requirements definition.
Returns the diagram of the latest version of the decision requirements 
definition for a tenant.

schema.description: For `image/*` Responses, a byte stream is returned.
For `application/octet-stream` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

The decision requirements definition doesn't have an associated diagram. This
method returns no content.

404.description:
Decision requirements definition with given id or key does not
exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
The key of the decision requirements definition (the latest version thereof) to be
retrieved.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: The id of the tenant to which the decision requirements definition belongs to.

post.description:
Queries for historic variable instances that fulfill the given parameters.
This method is slightly more powerful than the
[Get Variable Instances](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/variable-instance/get-variable-instance-query/)
method because it allows filtering by variable values of the different
types `String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

parameters.name: deserializeValues
parameters.description:
Determines whether serializable variable values (typically variables that
store custom Java objects) should be deserialized on server side (default
`true`).

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property
introspection feature. Note that this requires the Java classes of the
variable value to be on the REST API's classpath.

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

get.description:
Queries for historic variable instances that fulfill the given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Variable Instance Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/variable-instance/get-variable-instance-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: Filter by variable name.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to variables with a name like the parameter.

parameters.name: variableValue
parameters.description: Filter by variable value. Is treated as a `String` object on server side.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable name provided in `variableName` and `variableNameLike` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable value provided in `variableValue` case-insensitively. If set to `true`
**variableValue** and **variablevalue** are treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableTypeIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated variable types. A list of all supported variable types can be found
[here](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/#supported-variable-values).
**Note:** All non-primitive variables are associated with the type
'serializable'.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Include variables that has already been deleted during the execution.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the process instance the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated process instance ids.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by a key of the process definition the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: executionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated execution ids.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the case instance the variable belongs to.

parameters.name: caseExecutionIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated case execution ids.

parameters.name: caseActivityIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated case activity ids.

parameters.name: taskIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated task ids.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and and comma-separated activity instance ids.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-
separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic variable instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: variableNameIn
parameters.description: Only include historic variable instances which belong to one of the passed and comma-separated variable names.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

parameters.name: firstResult
parameters.description: Pagination of results. Specifies the index of the first result to return.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

If set to `true`, a serializable variable will be deserialized on server side
and transformed to JSON using
[Jackson's](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) POJO/bean property

If set to `false`, a serializable variable will be returned in its serialized
format. For example, a variable that is serialized as XML will be returned as
a JSON string containing XML.

**Note:** While `true` is the default value for reasons of backward
compatibility, we recommend setting this parameter to `false` when developing
web applications that are independent of the Java process applications
deployed to the engine.

get.description:

parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy` is specified. See the

for more information about authorization types.

for a list of integer representations of resource types.

options.description:
The OPTIONS request allows you to check for the set of available operations that the currently
authenticated user can perform on the `/authorization` resource. Whether the user can perform an operation
or not may depend on various factors, including the users authorizations to interact with this
resource and the internal configuration of the process engine.

get.description: Retrieves the latest version of the process definition which belongs to no tenant according to the `ProcessDefinition` interface in the engine.

400.description:
Process definition with given `key` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definition (the latest version thereof) to be retrieved.

delete.description: Deletes process definitions by a given key which belong to no tenant id.

403.description:
Forbidden
The process definitions with the given `key` cannot be deleted due to missing permissions.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Not found
Process definition with given `key` does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the process definitions to be deleted.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description:
`true`, if all process instances, historic process instances and jobs
for this process definition should be deleted.

parameters.name: skipCustomListeners
parameters.description: `true`, if only the built-in ExecutionListeners should be notified with the end event.

parameters.name: skipIoMappings
parameters.description:
A boolean value to control whether input/output mappings should be executed during deletion.
`true`, if input/output mappings should not be invoked.

get.description:
Queries for the number of user operation log entries that fulfill the given parameters.
Takes the same parameters as the
[Get User Operation Log (Historic)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/user-operation-log/get-user-operation-log-query/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by process definition id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Filter by process definition key.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by process instance id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Filter by execution id.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by case definition id.

parameters.name: caseInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by case instance id.

parameters.name: caseExecutionId
parameters.description: Filter by case execution id.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Only include operations on this task.

parameters.name: externalTaskId
parameters.description: Only include operations on this external task.

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: Only include operations on this batch.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Filter by job id.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by job definition id.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Only include operations of this user.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description:
Filter by the id of the operation. This allows fetching of multiple entries which are part
of a composite operation.

parameters.name: operationType
parameters.description:
Filter by the type of the operation like `Claim` or `Delegate`. See the
[Javadoc](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/javadoc/?org/camunda/bpm/engine/history/UserOperationLogEntry.html)
for a list of available operation types.

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description:
Filter by the type of the entity that was affected by this operation, possible values are
`Task`, `Attachment` or `IdentityLink`.

parameters.name: entityTypeIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of types of the entities that was affected by this operation,
possible values are `Task`, `Attachment` or `IdentityLink`.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
Filter by the category that this operation is associated with, possible values are
`TaskWorker`, `Admin` or `Operator`.

parameters.name: categoryIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of categories that this operation is associated with, possible values are
`TaskWorker`, `Admin` or `Operator`.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Only include operations that changed this property, e.g., `owner` or `assignee`.

parameters.name: afterTimestamp
parameters.description:
Restrict to entries that were created after the given timestamp. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
timestamp must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

parameters.name: beforeTimestamp
parameters.description:
Restrict to entries that were created before the given timestamp. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the
timestamp must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., 2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200.

put.description:
Sets the number of retries left to execute external tasks by id synchronously. If retries are set to 0, 
an incident is created.

400.description:
In case the number of retries is negative or null, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is
returned. See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task, 
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

requestBody.description: For binary variables a multipart form submit with the following parts:

example-3.value:
```
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="myFile.txt"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ---OSQH1f8lzs83iXFHphqfIuitaQfNKFY74Y
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        File
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-1.description: Post binary content of a byte array variable.
example-1.value:
```
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"; filename="image.png"
                        Content-Type: application/octet-stream
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

                        <<Byte Stream ommitted>>
                        ------------------------------354ddb6baeff
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="valueType"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        Bytes
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

example-2.description: Post the JSON serialization of a Java Class (**deprecated**).
example-2.value:
```
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="type"
                        Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a
                        Content-Disposition: form-data; name="data"
                        Content-Type: application/json; charset=US-ASCII
                        Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

                        ["foo","bar"]
                        ------------------------------1e838f8f632a--
                        ```

post.description:
Sets the serialized value for a binary variable or the binary value for a file variable visible from the
task. A variable is visible from the task if it is a local task variable or declared in a parent scope of
the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if no filename is set. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: varName
parameters.description: The name of the variable to retrieve.

get.description:
Retrieves a binary variable from the context of a given task. Applicable for byte array and file
variables. The variable must be visible from the task. It is visible from the task if it is a local task
variable or declared in a parent scope of the task. See documentation on
[visiblity of variables](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/variables/).

200.description:

        For binary variables or files without any MIME type information, a byte stream is returned.

        Additionally, for file variables the Content-Disposition header will be set.

for the error response format.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include batches which belong to no tenant.
Value can effectively only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: suspended
parameters.description:
A `Boolean` value which indicates whether only active or suspended batches should be included.
When the value is set to `true`, only suspended batches will be returned and
when the value is set to `false`, only active batches will be returned.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Only include batches that were started by this user id.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Only include batches that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Only include batches that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: withFailures
parameters.description:
Only include batches having jobs with failures.
Value can only be `true`.

parameters.name: withoutFailures
parameters.description:
Only include batches having jobs without failures.
Value can only be `true`.

get.description:
Queries for deployments that fulfill given parameters. Parameters may be the properties of deployments,
such as the id or name or a range of the deployment time. The size of the result set can be retrieved by
using the [Get Deployment count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/deployment/get-query-count/) method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder` parameter is supplied,
but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by deployment id

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment name. Exact match.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description:
Filter by the deployment name that the parameter is a substring of. The parameter can include the
wildcard `%` to express like-strategy such as: starts with (`%`name), ends with (name`%`) or contains
(`%`name`%`).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source.

parameters.name: withoutSource
parameters.description: Filter by the deployment source whereby source is equal to `null`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A deployment must have one of the given tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include deployments which belong to no tenant. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: includeDeploymentsWithoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Include deployments which belong to no tenant. Can be used in combination with `tenantIdIn`. Value may
only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments after the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Restricts to all deployments before the given date.
By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:

parameters.description:
Pagination of results. Specifies the maximum number of results to return.
Will return less results if there are no more results left.

options.description:
The `/group` resource supports two custom OPTIONS requests, this one for the resource as such and one for
individual group instances. The OPTIONS request allows checking for the set of available operations that
the currently authenticated user can perform on the `/group` resource. If the user can perform an operation
or not may depend on various things, including the users authorizations to interact with this resource and
the internal configuration of the process engine.

method.

parameters.name: taskDueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskDueDateBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskDueDateAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: withoutTaskDueDate
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: taskFollowUpDate
parameters.description:

e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskFollowUpDateBefore

post.description:
Correlates a message to the process engine to either trigger a message start event or an intermediate message 
catching event. Internally this maps to the engine's message correlation builder methods
`MessageCorrelationBuilder#correlateWithResult()` and `MessageCorrelationBuilder#correlateAllWithResult()`.
For more information about the correlation behavior, see the [Message Events](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/bpmn20/events/message-events/)
section of the [BPMN 2.0 Implementation Reference](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/bpmn20/).

200.description:
Request successful. The property `resultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.
The `variables` property is only returned, if the property variablesInResultEnable`
was set to `true` in the request.

example-1.description: The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).

example-2.description: The Response content of a status 200. The property `variablesInResultEnabled` in the request body was `true`.

400.description:
Returned if:
* no `messageName` was supplied
* both `tenantId` and `withoutTenantId` are supplied
* the message has not been correlated to exactly one entity (execution or process definition)
* the variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported.

See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling) for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. The property `resultEnabled` in the request body was `false` (Default).

method.

Queries for executions that fulfill given parameters through a JSON object.
This method is slightly more powerful than the [Get
Executions](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/get-query/) method
because it allows
to filter by multiple instance and execution variables of types
`String`, `Number` or `Boolean`.

for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the executions that fulfill given parameters.
Parameters may be static as well as dynamic runtime properties of
executions.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the [Get
Execution Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/execution/get-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`, or if an invalid operator
for variable comparison is used. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.description: Filter by the business key of the process instances the executions belong to.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Filter by the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.description: Filter by the key of the process definition the executions run on.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Filter by the id of the process instance the execution belongs to.

parameters.description: Filter by the id of the activity the execution currently executes.

parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a signal of the given name.

parameters.name: messageEventSubscriptionName
parameters.description: Select only those executions that expect a message of the given name.

parameters.description:
Only include active executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: suspended

Only include suspended executions. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Filter by the incident id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description: Filter by the incident type. See the [User Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types) for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message. Exact match.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description: Filter by the incident message that the parameter is a substring of.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. An execution must have one of the given
tenant ids.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that have variables with certain values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to; `gt` -
greater than;
`gteq` - greater than or equal to; `lt` - lower than; `lteq` - lower than or
equal to;
`like`.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: processVariables
parameters.description:
Only include executions that belong to a process instance with variables with certain
values.
Variable filtering expressions are comma-separated and are structured as
follows:

A valid parameter value has the form `key_operator_value`.
`key` is the variable name, `operator` is the comparison operator to be used
and `value` the variable value.
**Note:** Values are always treated as `String` objects on server side.

Valid operator values are: `eq` - equal to; `neq` - not equal to.
`key` and `value` may not contain underscore or comma characters.

parameters.name: variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable names provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match all variable values provided in `variables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

post.description:
Restarts process instances that were canceled or terminated asynchronously.
Can also restart completed process instances.
It will create a new instance using the original instance information.
To execute the restart asynchronously, use the
[Restart Process Instance](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/process-definition/post-restart-process-instance-sync/) method.

For more information about the difference between synchronous and asynchronous execution,
please refer to the related section of the
[User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/process-instance-restart/#execution).

400.description:
In case following parameters are missing: `instructions`, `activityId` or `transitionId`,
`processInstanceIds` or `historicProcessInstanceQuery`,
an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned. 
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

`operationId` path parameter value does not exists. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The operation id of the operation log to be updated.

post.description:
Schedules asynchronous history cleanup (See
[History cleanup](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#history-cleanup)).

**Note:** This endpoint will return at most a single history cleanup job.
Since version `7.9.0` it is possible to configure multiple
[parallel history cleanup jobs](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#parallel-execution). Use
[`GET /history/cleanup/jobs`](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/history-cleanup/get-history-cleanup-jobs)
to find all the available history cleanup jobs.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid or the engine
does not participate in history cleanup. See
[Cleanup Execution Participation per Node](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/history/#cleanup-execution-participation-per-node).

parameters.name: immediatelyDue
parameters.description:
When true the job will be scheduled for nearest future. When `false`, the job will be
scheduled for next batch window start time. Default is `true`.

put.description:
Activates or suspends jobs matching the given criterion.
This can only be on of:
* `jobDefinitionId`
* `processDefinitionId`
* `processInstanceId`
* `processDefinitionKey`

400.description:
Returned if the request parameters are invalid, for example, if `jobDefinitionId` and
`processDefinitionId` are both specified.
See the [Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. This method returns no content.

post.description: Completes a task and updates process variables.

200.description: Request successful. The response contains the process variables.

400.description:
The variable value or type is invalid, for example if the value could not be parsed
to an Integer value or the passed variable type is not supported. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

500.description:
If the task does not exist or the corresponding process instance could not be
resumed successfully. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

204.description: Request successful. The response contains no variables.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to complete.

options.description:
The `/user` resource supports two custom `OPTIONS` requests, one for the resource as such
and one for individual user instances. The `OPTIONS` request allows checking for the set of
available operations that the currently authenticated user can perform on the /user resource.
If the user can perform an operation or not may depend on various things, including the user's
authorizations to interact with this resource and the internal configuration of the process
engine. `OPTIONS /user/{id}` returns available interactions on a resource instance.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user to be deleted.

delete.description: Deletes a user by id.

403.description: Identity service is read-only (Cannot modify users / groups / memberships).

404.description:
A Deployment with the provided id does not exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user to be deleted.

post.description: Extends the timeout of the lock by a given amount of time.

400.description:
In case the new lock duration is negative or the external task is not locked by the given worker or not 
locked at all, an exception of type `InvalidRequestException` is returned. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:
Returned if the task does not exist. This could indicate a wrong task id as well as a cancelled task,
e.g., due to a caught BPMN boundary event. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the external task.

get.description:
Retrieves runtime statistics of the process engine, grouped by process definitions.
These statistics include the number of running process instances, optionally the number of failed jobs
and also optionally the number of incidents either grouped by incident types or
for a specific incident type.
**Note**: This does not include historic data.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid.
See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: failedJobs
parameters.description: Whether to include the number of failed jobs in the result or not. Valid values are `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: incidents
parameters.description:
Valid values for this property are `true` or `false`.
If this property has been set to `true` the result will include the corresponding number of incidents
for each occurred incident type.
If it is set to `false`, the incidents will not be included in the result.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidentsForType`.

parameters.name: incidentsForType
parameters.description:
If this property has been set with any incident type (i.e., a string value) the result
will only include the number of incidents for the assigned incident type.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidents`.
See the [User Guide](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: rootIncidents
parameters.description:
Valid values for this property are `true` or `false`.
If this property has been set to `true` the result will include the corresponding number of
root incidents for each occurred incident type.
If it is set to `false`, the incidents will not be included in the result.
Cannot be used in combination with `incidentsForType` or `incidents`.

get.description: Retrieves a task attachment by task id and attachment id.

get.summary: Get Decision Requirements Diagram by Key
get.description:
Retrieves the diagram of a decision requirements definition.
Returns the diagram for the latest version of the decision requirements 
definition which belongs to no tenant.

200.description: The image diagram of the decision requirements definition.

schema.description: For `image/*` Responses, a byte stream is returned.
For `application/octet-stream` Responses, a byte stream is returned.

204.description:
The decision requirements definition doesn't have an associated diagram. This
method returns no content.

404.description:
Decision requirements definition with given id or key does not
exist. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
The key of the decision requirements definition (the latest version thereof) to be
retrieved.

get.description:
Queries for historic incidents that fulfill given parameters.
The size of the result set can be retrieved by using the
[Get Incident Count](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/incident/get-incident-query-count/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid, for example if a `sortOrder`
parameter is supplied, but no `sortBy`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given id.

parameters.name: incidentType
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that belong to the given incident type. See the [User
Guide](/manual/develop/user-guide/process-engine/incidents/#incident-types)
for a list of incident types.

parameters.name: incidentMessage
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident message.

parameters.name: incidentMessageLike
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that incidents message is a substring of the given value.
The string can include the wildcard character '%' to express
like-strategy: starts with (string%), ends with (%string) or contains
(%string%).

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given processDefinitionKey.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given process definition keys.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to a process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an execution with the given id.

parameters.name: createTimeBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have a createTime date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: createTimeAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have a createTime date after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: endTimeBefore
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an endTimeBefore date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: endTimeAfter
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that have an endTimeAfter date after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/), the date must have the format
`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that belong to an activity with the given id.

parameters.name: failedActivityId
parameters.description:
Restricts to incidents that were created due to the failure of an activity with the given
id.

parameters.name: causeIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as cause incident.

parameters.name: rootCauseIncidentId
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given incident id as root cause incident.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as configuration.

parameters.name: historyConfiguration
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have the given parameter set as history configuration.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are open.

parameters.name: resolved
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are resolved.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that are deleted.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic incidents that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: jobDefinitionIdIn
parameters.description: Restricts to incidents that have one of the given comma-separated job definition ids.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Sort the results lexicographically by a given criterion.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortOrder parameter.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Sort the results in a given order. Values may be asc for ascending order or desc for descending order.
Must be used in conjunction with the sortBy parameter.

post.description:
Queries for the number of historic tasks that fulfill the given parameters. Takes the
same parameters as the [Get Tasks (Historic)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/task/get-task-query/)
method. Corresponds to the size of the result set of the
[Get Tasks (Historic) (POST)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/task/post-task-query/)
method and takes the same parameters.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

get.description:
Queries for the number of historic tasks that fulfill the given parameters.
Takes the same parameters as the
[Get Tasks (Historic)](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/history/task/get-task-query/)
method.

400.description:
Returned if some of the query parameters are invalid. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

parameters.name: taskId

The keys need to be in a comma-separated list.

parameters.description: Filter by  process instance business key that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey

parameters.name: caseInstanceId

parameters.name: caseDefinitionId

parameters.name: caseDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given key.

parameters.name: caseDefinitionName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that belong to a case definition with the given name.

parameters.name: activityInstanceIdIn
parameters.description: Only include tasks which belong to one of the passed comma-separated activity instance ids.

parameters.name: taskName
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given name.

parameters.name: taskNameLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a name with the given parameter value as substring.

parameters.name: taskDescription
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given description.

parameters.name: taskDescriptionLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a description that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given key.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyIn
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have one of the passed comma-separated task definition keys.

parameters.name: taskDeleteReason
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given delete reason.

parameters.name: taskDeleteReasonLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have a delete reason that has the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: taskAssignee
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user is assigned to.

parameters.name: taskAssigneeLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that are assigned to users with the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: taskOwner
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that the given user owns.

parameters.name: taskOwnerLike
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that are owned by users with the parameter value as a substring.

parameters.name: taskPriority
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks that have the given priority.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are assigned.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: If set to `true`, restricts the query to all tasks that are unassigned.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description: Only include finished tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: unfinished
parameters.description:
Only include unfinished tasks. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the default
behavior.

parameters.name: processFinished
parameters.description:
Only include tasks of finished processes. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: processUnfinished
parameters.description:
Only include tasks of unfinished processes. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: taskDueDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due on the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskDueDateBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskDueDateAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that are due after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: withoutTaskDueDate
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no due date. Value may only be `true`, as `false` is the
default behavior.

parameters.name: taskFollowUpDate
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date on the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskFollowUpDateBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: taskFollowUpDateAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that have a followUp date after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were started before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were started after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were finished before the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: finishedAfter
parameters.description:
Restrict to tasks that were finished after the given date. By [default](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/date-format/),
the date must have the format `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`,
e.g., `2013-01-23T14:42:45.000+0200`.

parameters.name: tenantIdIn
parameters.description:
Filter by a comma-separated list of tenant ids. A task instance must have one of the given
tenant ids.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description:
Only include historic task instances that belong to no tenant. Value may only be
`true`, as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: taskVariables
processVariables
variableNamesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable name provided in `taskVariables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableName** and **variablename** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: variableValuesIgnoreCase
parameters.description:
Match the variable value provided in `taskVariables` and `processVariables` case-
insensitively. If set to `true` **variableValue** and **variablevalue** are
treated as equal.

parameters.name: taskInvolvedUser
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with a historic identity link to the given user.

parameters.name: taskInvolvedGroup
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with a historic identity link to the given group.

parameters.name: taskHadCandidateUser
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with a historic identity link to the given candidate user.

parameters.name: taskHadCandidateGroup
parameters.description: Restrict to tasks with a historic identity link to the given candidate group.

parameters.name: withCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have a candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

parameters.name: withoutCandidateGroups
parameters.description:
Only include tasks which have no candidate group. Value may only be `true`,
as `false` is the default behavior.

post.description: Verifies that user credentials are valid.

400.description: If body does not contain username or password.

which belongs to no tenant.

for example if the provided `executionDate` parameter doesn't have the expected format or
if the `processDefinitionKey` parameter is `null`. See the
[Introduction](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.19/reference/rest/overview/#error-handling)
for the error response format.

404.description:

for the error response format.

Historic batch with given id does not exist. See the
